cciOption.name: -auto_scale
cciOption.help: Enables automatic divide and conquer for scaling up to big designs.

cciOption.name: -line_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running line cov metric

cciOption.name: -cond_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running cond cov metric

cciOption.name: -branch_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running branch cov metric

cciOption.name: -tgl_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running tgl cov metric

cciOption.name: -fsm_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running fsm cov metric

cciOption.name: -cg_task
cciOption.help: To specify the number of parallel tasks for running cg cov metric

cciOption.name: -limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold coverage percentage. Default is 70. Any module whose total coverage % is greater than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -line_limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold value for line cov metric. Any module whose number of uncovered goals for line metric is lesser than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -branch_limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold value for branch cov metric. Any module whose number of uncovered goals for branch metric is lesser than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -tgl_limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold value for toggle cov metric. Any module whose number of uncovered goals for toggle metric is lesser than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -fsm_limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold value for fsm cov metric. Any module whose number of uncovered goals for fsm metric is lesser than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -cond_limit
cciOption.help: To set the threshold value for condition cov metric. Any module whose number of uncovered goals for condition metric is lesser than the specified value would be ignored by FCA/UNR

cciOption.name: -module
cciOption.help: To specify the scope from where to start doing divide and conquer. Default is to start from top module sent to Formal.

cciOption.name: -task_goal_limit
cciOption.help: To set the maximum number of coverage goals per task.

cciOption.name: -inst_list
cciOption.help: To specify instance/instances in the input coverage database hierarchy from where to start doing divide and conquer. Default is to start from the top instance.

cciOption.name: -start_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after individual task creation in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -end_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after check_fv is finished for each individual task in auto scale flow.

cciOption.name: -start_line_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of line metric in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -start_cond_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of cond metric in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -start_branch_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of branch in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -start_tgl_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of tgl in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -start_fsm_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of fsm in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -start_cg_task_cmd
cciOption.help: To specify commands to invoke after task creation of cg in auto scale flow and before invoking check_fv.

cciOption.name: -incr_excl_pct
cciOption.help: To set the percentage value for Converged Cov Goals w.r.t Total Cov Goals to call save exclusion incrementally.

cciOption.name: -save_exclusions_incr

cciOption.help: Saves exclusion file for assumes.

cciOption.name: -exclude_bb_signals
cciOption.help: Automatically exclude blackbox signals in covdb.

cciCmd.name: read_covdb
cciCmd.info: The read_covdb command can be used to import a simulation coverage database. The return value is 1 for success and 0 for error scenarios. The read_covdb command implies that VC FV should perform analysis of only those coverage goals that are not yet resolved in the imported database. This command needs to be given prior to the read_file or elaborate command, as the filtering of covered goals happens as the design is built. If this command is given after the read_file or elaborate, VC Formal reports an error.

cciOption.name: -cov_input
cciOption.help: Input coverage database path for code coverage shape

cciOption.name: -cov_dut
cciOption.help: DUT instance in the input coverage database

cciOption.help: Exclusion file list to be sent with input coverage database

cciOption.help: Enables validation of coverage items that are excluded in the provided exclusion file(s)

cciOption.name: -fv_dut

cciOption.name: -bb_el

cciOption.help: Filters out coverage goals which are unintentionally covered or intentionally uncoverable

cciOption.value_help: <space separated list of real clocks on block input pins>

cciOption.name: -output
cciOption.value_help: <space separated list of virtual clocks on block output pins>
cciOption.help: Specify the output clock of the abstract model. The domain of the clock reaching from the top on this block level input clock specified in the input option of this command would be assigned to the output clocks.

cciCmd.name: configure_clock_propagation
cciCmd.info: This command configures the propagation of clock

cciOption.name: -infer_strict_gen_clock
cciOption.help: To disable the propagation of derived clocks through those combinational logic where user defined clock is also reaching

cciOption.name: -propagate_on_hanging_pins
cciOption.help: When set to yes clock would be propagated to a path whose end point is a hanging pin

cciOption.name: -propagate_through_tristate_enable
cciOption.help: To enable the propagation of user clock through tristate enable pin

cciOption.name: -derived_clk_thru_mux_sel
cciOption.help: To enable disable clock propagation from the output of a derived flip-flop through the MUX select pin. Default: false.

cciOption.name: -clk_thru_mux_sel
cciOption.help: To enable disable the propagation of clock through sel pin of mux. Default: true, Clock propagation continues through the MUX select pin when the MUX inputs are tied to a constant value through the set_case_analysis constraint irrespective of any value specified

cciOption.name: -disable_default_clk_thru_seq_setting
cciOption.help: To disable the default setting for propagation of clock through sequential

cciOption.name: -prop_thru_quasi_static
cciOption.help: To Enable the propagation of clock signals through quasi static path. Default: false

cciOption.name: -propagate_through_latch_enable
cciOption.help: To enable the propagation of user clock through latch enable pin. Default : false

cciOption.name: -mux_domain_optimization
cciOption.help: By Default same domain ID is provided at the output of 2 mux having same select and same input domain IDs. when this option set to false, different domain IDs would be provided at the output of 2 mux having same select and same input domain IDs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -allow_abstracted_clock_as_derived
cciOption.help: To enable the propagation of clock through sequential when it drives input pin of constrained based abstracted block which has clock definition on it. Default : false

cciOption.name: -unknown_clock_phase_through_seq
cciOption.help: When set to true it will update the clock phase to be of unknown type while passing through sequential. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_driving_sequential_bbox_pins
cciOption.help: By Default, Tag SETUP_CLOCK_PROPAGATED fields SeqPinReachable and BBoxPinReachable reports the clock reaching data pins count similar to spyglass, when -report_clock_driving_sequential_bbox_pins set to ture, SeqPinReachable and BBoxPinReachable fields represent the actual clock pins count for sequentials and blackbox respectivly. Default:false

cciOption.name: -propagate_through_mux_select_non_const
cciOption.help: setting it allows to handle reset propagation through mux select line when there are non constant mux inputs, Default: default

cciOption.name: -derive_resets_through_mux_select
cciOption.help: setting it allows to find derived resets through mux select line, Default: default

cciOption.name: -target_reset

cciOption.help: Ignore overlapping resets and continue propagation, Default: false

cciOption.name: -stop_at_soft_reset
cciOption.help: stop propagation of fanin reset at the presence of soft reset, Default: false

cciOption.name: -propagate_through_tristate_enable
cciOption.help: setting it allows Reset propagation of user reset through tristate enable pin, Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_reset_attribute
cciOption.help: setting it allows to enable/disable the association of lib-cell data pins to all Clear/Preset pins when the reset to data relation is missing in lib cell definition. Default: true

cciOption.name: -always_propagate_through_uds
cciOption.help: setting it allows reset propagation through user defined synchronizers even when UDS output is not driving any set/reset pin. Default: true

cciCmd.name: create_reset
cciCmd.info: Creates a reset

cciOption.name: -sync
cciOption.help: If signal drives synchronous reset. If this option is not provided then reset is taken as async by default.

cciOption.name: -async
cciOption.help: If signal drives asynchronous reset.

cciOption.name: -both
cciOption.help: If signal drives either asynchronous reset or synchronous reset or both. If this option is not provided then reset is taken as async by default.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: specifies the type of reset signal, Default: reset

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: specifies the name of reset signal

cciOption.name: -sense
cciOption.help: Specifies active value for set/reset, low means the reset is asserted with value 0, high indicates the reset is asserted with value 1. Default: high. When app-var enable_rdc or enable_cdc or enable_lint is set, then Default is used as low, otherwise high. This option is not recommended and the new option -value is to be used in place of -sense.

cciOption.name: -value
cciOption.help: Specifies active value for set/reset, low means the reset is asserted with value 0, high indicates the reset is asserted with value 1. Default: high. When app-var enable_rdc or enable_cdc or enable_lint is set, then Default is used as low, otherwise high.

cciOption.name: -add
cciOption.help: Add new options to the original reset

cciOption.name: -tdr
cciOption.help: If signal is test and/or debug reset

cciOption.name: -disable_assertions_db
cciOption.help: Disable AssertionDB generation for a constraint

cciOption.name: -untimed
cciOption.help: Specifies that reset signal is not a clocked output of a sequential element

cciOption.name: -rise_to

cciOption.name: -fall_from

cciOption.name: -fall_through

cciOption.help: Specifies whether to add delay information to the existing output delay

cciOption.help: Names of ports to continue advanced reset propagation.

cciCmd.info: Specifies reset propagation stop points.

cciOption.name: -resets
cciOption.help: Filters which resets this command gets applied to.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Specifies if command will be honored for async reset type or sync reset type, Default: both

cciOption.name: -soft
cciOption.help: Specify to stop reporting missing soft resets

cciCmd.name: set_resistance
cciCmd.info: Set resistance on nets

cciOption.name: -min
cciOption.help: Specify the minimum resistance value

cciOption.name: -max
cciOption.help: Specify the maximum resistance value

cciCmd.name: set_sense
cciCmd.info: Specifies unateness propagating forward for pins with respect to clock source.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Specifies whether the sense is applied to clock or data net-works.

cciOption.name: -positive
cciOption.help: Applies positive unateness to all pins in the object_list with respect to clock source.

cciOption.name: -negative
cciOption.help: Applies negative unateness to all pins in the object_list with respect to clock source.

cciOption.name: -non_unate
cciOption.help: Launches both the positive-unate sense and the negative-unate sense of the clock from the clock source.

cciOption.name: -stop_propagation
cciOption.help: Stops the propagation of specified clocks in the clock_list from the specified pins or cell timing arcs in the object_list.

cciOption.name: -clock_leaf
cciOption.help: Specify clock pin as a leaf pin.

cciOption.name: -pulse
cciOption.help: Specifies the type of pulse clock applied to all pins in the object_list with respect to clock source.

cciOption.name: -clocks
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of clock objects to be applied with the given unateness that is placed on all pin objects in the object_list.

cciCmd.name: abstract_port
cciCmd.info: Specify to model pins/ports of blackbox, top module, library cells

cciOption.name: -module
cciOption.help: Specifies the module name to be modelled

cciOption.name: -clock
cciOption.help: Specifies the clock-name or clock-object to be associated with the modelled pin/port

cciOption.name: -reset
cciOption.help: Specifies the reset-name or reset-object to be associated with the modelled pin/port

cciOption.name: -combo
cciOption.help: Specifies the combo property associated with the modelled object

cciOption.name: -clock_phase
cciOption.help: Specifies phase relationship of clock to related port

cciOption.name: -path_phase
cciOption.help: Specifies phase relationship of related ports with respect to the output ports. Default Value is noninv.

cciOption.name: -multiple_virtual_clock
cciOption.help: Specify this option to model block port being driven by multiple data path domain whose clock is not reaching the block (i.e. virtual clock at block).

cciOption.name: -combo_ifn
cciOption.help: Add the clock asscociated with combo logic sequential

cciOption.name: -sync
cciOption.help: Specifies if the provided synchronizer is active/inactive ( can synchronize other crossings or not)

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specifies names of sdc clocks/ related clock pins (should exist) to which clocks reach or on which clocks are defined of the synchronizer source.

cciOption.name: -to
cciOption.help: Specifies names of sdc clocks/ related clock pins (should exist) to which clocks reach or on which clocks are defined of the synchronizer destination.

cciOption.name: -seq_depth
cciOption.help: Specifies the sequential depth by which the synchronizer reaches the virtual node. Default depth is 0.

cciOption.name: -sync_names
cciOption.help: Specifies the synchronizer name reaching the virtual node. If same synchronizers are reaching two virtual nodes, both nodes will have same sync_names of the sync_attribute

cciOption.name: -src_sync
cciOption.help: Specifies the source side qualifier information for the virtual source.

cciOption.name: -path_logic
cciOption.help: Type of connection

cciOption.name: -single_non_quasi
cciOption.help: whether signal is non quasi port

cciOption.name: -related_ports
cciOption.help: Names of the connected input ports

cciOption.name: -ports
cciOption.help: Names of the modelled ports

cciOption.name: -start
cciOption.help: Indicates that domain and other CDC attribute assumptions are taken for the port's fan-in cone

cciOption.name: -end
cciOption.help: Indicates that domain and other CDC attribute assumptions are taken for the port's fan-out cone

cciOption.name: -direction
cciOption.help: Direction of inout port/pin only to which this attribute is applicable

cciOption.name: -ignore
cciOption.help: Ignore existing constraint on object provided

cciOption.name: -seq
cciOption.help: Specifies the modelled synchronizer has sequential in the path

cciCmd.info: Attaches the given attribute to list of pin/port as driver/load constraint.

cciOption.name: -add
cciOption.help: Specify if this command is not to be treated as overwrite

cciOption.name: -direction

cciOption.name: -start
cciOption.help: Indicates that domain and other CDC attribute assumptions are taken for the port's fan-in cone

cciOption.name: -end
cciOption.help: Indicates that domain and other CDC attribute assumptions are taken for the port's fan-out cone

cciOption.name: -j
cciOption.help: Specifies the number of processes to use for parallel analysis

cciOption.help: Run RDC checks of particular type. If -type is not specified then all setup, integrity, corruption, convergence and glitch stage checks will run by default.

cciOption.name: -j
cciOption.help: Specifies the number of processes to use for parallel analysis

cciCmd.name: compress_cdc
cciCmd.info: Compresses CDC violations covered by a representative violation

cciOption.name: -enable

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disables the compression

cciCmd.info: Compresses RDC violations covered by a representative violation

cciOption.name: -enable
-disable

cciOption.name: -scenarios
cciOption.help: This option will work in Multi-Scenario flow and compression will be applied for given set of scenarios only.

cciCmd.name: configure_abstract_port
cciCmd.info: Configure abstract_port command

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Give preference to abstract_port command over apply_attribute command. Default : none

cciOption.name: -restricted_use
cciOption.help: Restrict usage of abstract_port command. Default: none

cciOption.name: -infer_virtual_clock
cciOption.help: Set this to infer virtual clock for abstract_port command, if no valid clock/clock-object found. Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_virtual_reset
cciOption.help: Set this to infer virtual reset for abstract_port command, if no valid reset/reset-object found. Default: false

cciOption.help: Specifies a list of primary input or inout ports to be treated as potential qualifiers for design abstraction for CDC

cciOption.name: -exclude_fully
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of primary input or inout ports to be ignored completely as start points for design abstraction for CDC

cciOption.name: -potential_qual_applies_to
cciOption.help: Specifies parameter for which potential qualifier applies for abstraction

cciOption.name: -enable_floating_convergence
cciOption.help: Enable abstraction of floating (non-observable) convergence

cciOption.name: -qual_port_max_width
cciOption.help: Maximum width upto which an input port will be treated as potential qualifier during abstraction

cciOption.name: -qual_port_conv_depth
cciOption.help: Convergence depth to conconsider for potential qualifier port during abstraction

cciOption.name: -qual_port_sync_depth
cciOption.help: Sync depth to conconsider for potential qualifier port during abstraction

cciOption.name: -preserve_potential_reset_nffs
cciOption.help: >Preserve potential reset NFF structure where back to back flops are connected to unconstrained primary input ports.

cciOption.name: -read_block_clocks_for_top
cciOption.help: Enables generating and reading of block-level non-input clocks for top run. Default:false.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_asyncrst_crossing
cciCmd.info: Configures crossing detection on asynchronous reset paths

cciOption.name: -allow_unconstrained_reset_in_rip
cciOption.help: Configures if a reset path crossing would be ignored if unconstrained reset source object is specified in "from_rst" field of set_asyncrst_ignore_path command. Default : false

cciOption.name: -analyze_quasi_static_paths
cciOption.help: Configures if reset paths analysis needs to be performed on quasi-static path. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_buf_inv_in_rip
cciOption.help: Specify this option to propagate the set_asyncrst_ignore_path constraint backwards ignoring buffers/inverters from objects specified with -from/-to/-from_reset of this constraint. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_asyncrst_data_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the data synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, data synchronization analysis is skipped for reset crossing-paths, hence crossings will either be reported as unsynchronized or control-path synchronized

cciOption.name: -allow_complex_mux_recirc
cciOption.help: It allows additional combinational logic driven by destination domain signal within mux recirculation structure

cciOption.name: -skip_autoqual
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, tool auto-inferred NFF & UDS are not used as synchronizers for data synchronization analysis for reset path crossings. Only user defined qualifiers are allowed as synchronizers for data synchronization analysis

cciOption.name: -allow_merged_qualifier
cciOption.help: gate at which source and the qualifier merges act as a new qualifier for other sources

cciOption.name: -incr
cciOption.help: It disables the creation of new qualifiers on the output of cells specified by -des_qual if an auto detected qualifier is not found

cciOption.name: -des_qual
cciOption.help: It specifies the qualifier signal which blocks the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -des_enable_expr
cciOption.help: It specifies the enable expression signal which enables the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -des_enable_expr_validate
cciOption.help: It specifies the type of validation to be performed on the specified enable expression. Default: obj_reachable

cciOption.name: -des_qual_depth
cciOption.help: It specifies the maximum valid sequential depth of a qualifier. Default:0

cciOption.name: -ignore_des_qual
cciOption.help: It specifies the synchronizers that are not allowed as qualifiers

cciOption.name: -sync_point
cciOption.help: It defines legal synchronization points for blocking condition detection. Default : {and mux_select mux_recirc clock_gate sync_point_cell }

cciOption.name: -sync_point_cell
cciOption.help: It specifies modules or cells that are valid for blocking condition

cciOption.name: -sync_check_type
cciOption.help: It specifies the type of synchronizer check to be performed. Default: qual_only

cciOption.name: -sync_point_qualifier
cciOption.help: When set to "all", all the qualifier that can block the source on a blocking gate are reported Default : first

cciOption.name: -sync_point_select
cciOption.help: Specifies the location priority of the blocking gate with respect to source node of a crossing. Default:NONE

cciOption.name: -sync_point_report_limit
cciOption.help: Specified the maximum number of blocking gates on which source can be blocked. Default:5

cciOption.name: -dual_qual_reqd
cciOption.help: It allows user to specify that both source and destination qualifier are required to synchronize data crossing

cciOption.name: -validate_on_domain
cciOption.help: It validates the user provided constraint on domains of provided from_clock and to_clock instead of clocks.

cciOption.name: -analyze_async_sources
cciOption.help: configures if synchornization checks needs to be performed for asynchronus sources(differrent clock domains) converging at same point. Default: false

cciOption.name: -dynamic_side_channel
cciOption.help: configures if deterministic gates in merged qual path with other inputs in destination domain are to be treated as buffers for dynamic sync analysis. default : true

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_prop_across_dest
cciOption.help: Configures if qualifiers are allowed to propagate across the destination of crossing paths, to perform synchronization analysis on other crossings. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_cascaded_cgc
cciOption.help: configures if cascaded clock gating cells are to be allowed during clock_gate synchornization scheme. Only cascaded lib-cell clock gate cells are supported under this option. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_thru_cgc_gen_clock
cciOption.help: Allows qualifiers to be propagted through CGC cells, on the output of which generated clocks synchronous to destination domain are defined. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_sync_clocks_qual
cciOption.help: Enabling this configuration would allow qualifiers of clocks, synchronous to destination clocks for synchronization checks. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_thru_upf
cciOption.help: configures if qualifiers to be propagated through logic insturmented using UPF files. Default:false

cciOption.name: -enable_syncpoint_reporting
cciOption.help: Enabling this configuration would report the blocking gate for synchronized crossings. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_reset_domain_qual
cciOption.help: When enabled, it allows the qualifier with same reset domain as that of async reset path crossing. Default:true

cciOption.name: -allow_all_syncpoint_for_user_qual
cciOption.help: When set to true, all types of sync gate are considered valid for user specified qualifiers. Default : true

cciOption.name: -disable_des_qual_validation
cciOption.help: When set to true, qualifiers specified using "-des_qual" option in the subsequent commands are not validated for the presence of valid clocks in the fanin-cone. Default : false

cciOption.name: -blocking_gate_modules
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of modules, the blocking-gates of which can use auto-inferred qualifiers for synchronization analysis.

cciOption.name: -blocking_gate_instances
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of module/lib-cell instances, the blocking-gates of which can use auto-inferred qualifiers for synchronization analysis.

cciOption.name: -enable_autoqual
cciOption.help: configure if auto-inferred qualifiers are allowed on a blocking gate or not

cciOption.name: -enable_deassertion_checks
cciOption.help: configures if deassertion analysis needs to be performed for reset path crossings. Default:true

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_asyncrst_nff_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the multi-flop synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: It disables the auto detection of multi-flop synchronizers

cciOption.name: -depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential depth to be considered as valid multi-flop synchronizer. The depth will be considered value specified and above (depth 1 indicates sequential depth of 1 or more to be considered as valid multiflop synchronizer). Default value: 2

cciOption.name: -allowed_modules
cciOption.help: Restricts NFF synchronizer detection to specified modules

cciOption.name: -uds_modules
cciOption.help: specifies user defined synchronizer cells

cciOption.name: -modules
cciOption.help: This option is used to provide modules (uds/monitor/ignore_latch) to the tool using -type option(mandatory with -modules). type monitor specifies modules for which tool detected nff structures need to be monitored. type uds specifies modules which act as uds/synchronizer cells. An unused uds violation is thrown of constraints for which no monitored/uds crossing is found.ignore_latch options specifies the latch modules/instances to be ignored while traversing from crossing destination.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: This option is used to specify type of module (provided using -module option). This can be also be used with -to_obj option to specify instances whose crossings need to be monitored. See -module option for more details. Default : uds.

cciOption.name: -ignore_multi_domain_sources
cciOption.help: setting it to true will consider a destination for multi-flop synchronizer detection, even if multiple domains srcs are driving the destination. Default:yes

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi_static
cciOption.help: setting it allows combinational logic between the synchronizer flip-flops if the combinational logic is probable buffer path as side inputs are quasi-static. Default:no

cciOption.name: -allow_latch
cciOption.help: setting it allows latch in multi-flop synchronizer chain. Default:flop_chain

cciOption.name: -allow_half_sync
cciOption.help: configure flops with inverted clock-polarity for NFF detection. Default:unset

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clk_period
cciOption.help: configure flops with different clock periods for NFF detection. Default:true

cciOption.name: -detect_potential_synchronizers
cciOption.help: Detect potential synchronizers in allowed modules. Default:no

cciOption.name: -remove_redundant_logic
cciOption.help: Reduce redundant logic in nff chain Default : true

cciOption.name: -allow_parallel_synchronizers
cciOption.help: Allow nffs which have parallel synchronizer flops after destination to be marked as valid synchronizer structures Default : false

cciOption.name: -suppress_unobservable
cciOption.help: Type of crossing required to be suppressed. This option accepts a list. By default, no value is provided.

cciOption.name: -strict
cciOption.help: Type of method to detect unobservable object

cciOption.name: -auto_detect_sync_cell
cciOption.help: Type of libcell inside which NFF detection needs to be done. Default:none

cciOption.name: -data_pin_connectivity
cciOption.help: Configuration for connectivity of data pin of a valid synchronizer.Default:no_check.

cciOption.name: -filter_unused_synchronizer
cciOption.help: configures violation reporting for unused synchronizers. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_pulse_synchronizer
cciOption.help: configures if pulse synchornizer structure is to be treated as valid NFF. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clock_net
cciOption.help: Configures NFF detection of destinations having different clock nets than the corresponding synchronizer flop. If set to false, such structures would be marked invalid NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_full_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration outputs the name of complete nff chain in synchronizer_flop_chain attribute. default:false

cciOption.name: -same_hier_level
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to specify common hierarchy level within which the NFF flops should reside.This will limit the number of hierarchical levels. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -src_count
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to limit the number of sources of a destination to be considered valid for NFF or UDS analysis. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if quasi gate is allowed in chain. Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_asyncrst_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if asyncrst gate is allowed in chain.Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_buf_equiv_logic
cciOption.help: Configuration is used to specify if buffer equivalent logic is allowed in the detection of NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_insufficient_depth_nff
cciOption.help: Detectes NFF chains which do not meet the user depth criteira. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_dest_recirc
cciOption.help: When this configuration to true, destination fanout which is recirculating back to destination is not considered as a meta-fanout. Default:false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_attribute
cciCmd.info: Use this command to specify mutually exclusive and unrelated signals such that convergence and glitch related violations are suppressed for such signals.

cciOption.name: -exclusive
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which act as mutually exclusive signals in the design

cciOption.name: -unrelated
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which act as unrelated signals in the design

cciOption.name: -disable_assertions_db
cciOption.help: Disable AssertionDB generation for a constraint

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_auto_abstraction
cciCmd.info: Configures design auto abstraction in cdc flow

cciOption.name: -j
cciOption.help: Number of threads to be used in parallel mode, default value is 4

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_back_to_back_uds
cciCmd.info: This constraint is used to specify crossing sources so that CDC_SYNC_UDS_RESYNC will analyze them for back to back synchronizer usage.

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: Specify crossing source pin, to report back to back UDS synchronizer information.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_clock_glitch
cciCmd.info: This command is used to configure reporting of clock glitch paths

cciOption.name: -enable_sync_analysis
cciOption.help: When set to true, synchronization analysis for clock-glitch paths is enabled. Default false

cciOption.name: -enable_src_reporting
cciOption.help: When set to true, clock glitch violations are reported based on enable signals. Default false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_convergence
cciCmd.info: Configures several convergence detection criteria

cciOption.name: -num_convergences
cciOption.help: Specifies the number of parallel convergences to be reported for any set of synchronizers. Default : 1

cciOption.name: -stop_at_sources
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to stop at sources of other crossings or not. Default : false

cciOption.name: -ignore_among_signals
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which must be synchronizer output pins, among which convergences should not be reported

cciOption.name: -stop_at_clock
cciOption.help: true: qualifier is allowed to propagate through the clock-pin of the sequential elements for convergence analysis.false: qualifier is not allowed to propagate through clock-pin of the sequential elments for convergence analysis.except_cgc_sync_path: qualifier is allowed to propagate through clock-pin of the sequential elements if it reaches the clock-pin through a clock-gate cell within the sequential depth specified for data synchronization analysis. Default : true

cciOption.name: -stop_at_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to stop at reset. Default : true

cciOption.name: -disable_schematic
cciOption.help: If set to true, schematic generation of convergence violations will be disabled. Default : false

cciOption.name: -stop_at_reset_of_diff_clk_seq
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to stop at reset of diff domain. Default : true

cciOption.name: -ignore_reset_port_for_multisync
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to ignore no convergence multiple sync violation which have reset ports as source. Default : false

cciOption.name: -ignore_diffdom_paths
cciOption.help: When set to true, convergence of paths leading to different domain sequentials (immediate - sequential just next to convergence port) will be ignored. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_conv_at_sync_output
cciOption.help: When set to true, We will report convergence at a auto detected multiflop synchronizer output if another auto detected multiflop synchronizer is reaching the output of first multiflop synchronizer. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_multiasyncsrc_as_sync
cciOption.help: When set to true,convergence of synchronizers which have multiple source domains will be reported as sync source convergence . Default : false

cciOption.name: -enable_conv_check_at_soc
cciOption.help: By default, in the SoC run - Convergence analysis is not performed for the top signals which are converging inside the abstract block.Set this argument to enable the convergence analysis on the input ports of the abstracted block which are specified through set_cdc_convergence_ports command. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_sync_reset_as_conv_point
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to report convergence on synchronous reset path Default : false

cciOption.name: -cdc_conv_seq_depth_max
cciOption.help: Specifies the maximum sequential depth till which convergence has to be found. Default : 1

cciOption.name: -cdc_diverge_src_seq_depth_max
cciOption.help: Specifies the maximum sequential depth for determing the diverging source. Default : 0

cciOption.name: -convergence_check_type
cciOption.help: Specifies the types of synchronized paths participating input convergence detection, Please configure stop_at_reset argument for reset-sync convergences. Default : control

cciOption.name: -clock_relation_criteria
cciOption.help: The configuration controls, if the convergence of two or more synchronizers should be considered a valid coherency issue based on the relationship between the destination and source clocks of the synchronizers. if the destination clocks of the converging synchronizers are related, a convergence violation would be reported. The relationship among the source-clocks of the synchronizers categories the convergence violation into relevant tags. Default: disabled

cciOption.name: -report_async_seq
cciOption.help: Control for reporting sequential asynchronous source convergence

cciOption.name: -ignore_through_objects
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects(nets/pins/top level ports) beyond which convergences should not be reported

cciOption.name: -ignore_at_objects
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects(nets/pins/top level ports) at which convergence should not be reported

cciOption.name: -ignore_sources
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects for the source at which CDC_NOCONV_MULTI_SYNC won't be reported

cciOption.name: -allow_multiple_sync
cciOption.help: Configure types of synchronizers that will take part in multiple sync violations. Default:all

cciOption.name: -enable_scg_based_analysis
cciOption.help: If set to true, qualifiers having any one clock pair as synchronous will be reported in a single convergence violation. These violations will only be reported on sequentials Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_reset_endpoints
cciOption.help: Controls reporting of reset/set endpoints of a convergence violation. If set to true, all endpoints which are set/reset pins will be reported. If set to false, none will be reported,Default : true

cciOption.name: -lite_mode_violation
cciOption.help: If set to true, convergence violation reported will have only qualifier list , endpoint names and convergence points as the violation fields.This option is valid only when clock_relation_criteria option is specified. Default: true

cciOption.name: -enable_report_convergence_qualifier
cciOption.help: If set to true, user will be able to use report_convergence_qualifier command to report path of a convergence qualifier. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_set_reset_latch
cciOption.help: If set to true, convergence will be reported through const-enable set reset latches. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_coherency_multisync_overlap
cciOption.help: If set to true, same source multiple synchronizer coherency violations will be reported even if a convergence violation is reported for the same set of synchronizers. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_depth_infinite_flow
cciOption.help: If set to true, exact depth will be reported for qualifiers in convergence violations in infinite depth flow. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_assertions_db
cciOption.help: Disable AssertionDB generation for a constraint

cciOption.name: -hier_modules
cciOption.help: If valid hier_modules are provided using this option , the convergence violation will have another field `ConvergenceType`.This field will have value Local when all the synchronizers and convergence point in the violation lie within the same hierarchical module. When synchronizer or convergence lie in different hierarchical module or top module, then it will contain Global. Two extra fields `HierModule` and `HierInstance`, containing hierarchical module and hierarchical instance will also be reported when local value is reported.

cciOption.name: -unrelated
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which act as unrelated signals in the design

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of source and destination name and clock information for the specified check. Default: none

cciOption.name: -report_async_endpoints
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to determine which end-points should be considered for a convergence-point. Default: none

cciOption.name: -disable_endpoint_type
cciOption.help: Controls reporting of set_reset/io_ports(input,output & bidirectional) endpoints of a convergence violation. Provided endpoints types will not be reported in convergence violation.Default : none

cciOption.name: -merge_coherency_multisync_violations
cciOption.help: If set to true, no convergence multiple sync violations having sources of same bus will be merged in a single violation. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_intermediate_ignore_signals
cciOption.help: When set to true, the signals specified in the combinational fanout of the synchronizer outputs will also be allowed for ignore_among_singals. Default:false

cciOption.name: -filter
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, the convergence violation that are local to the modules specified using -hier_modules option will be suppressed

cciOption.name: -ignore_buf_inv
cciOption.help: When set to true, the signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals' will be the back-propagated across buffers and inverters. Default: false

cciOption.name: -disable_cdc_attrib_propagation
cciOption.help: Set this option to 'true' to disable the forward-propagation of signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals'. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_crossing
cciCmd.info: Enables various configurations on crossing generation, such as disable complex seq/primary ports as crossing start/end points or per domain limit of start points

cciOption.name: -disable_complex_seq
cciOption.help: Do not consider complex seq as start/end points of a crossing. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_complex_iopad
cciOption.help: Do not consider iopad as start/end points of a crossing Default : false

cciOption.name: -show_progress_per_crossing_count
cciOption.help: Show crossing generation progress report per crossing count. Default : 100000)

cciOption.name: -per_domain_start_points_limit
cciOption.help: Limits count of sequential elements for crossing start points for each domain to be considered for crossing generation. Default : 0

cciOption.name: -skip_domains
cciOption.help: specifies list of destination domain ids which are to be skipped for crossing generation

cciOption.name: -disable_icg_cell
cciOption.help: Do not consider ICG cell as source of a crossing. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_clock_source_crossing
cciOption.help: Disables identification of crossings whose source is a clock port. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_reset_source_crossing
cciOption.help: Disables identification of crossings when sdc reset is provided on any object in crossing path. Default : false

cciOption.name: -reset_cross_seq
cciOption.help: Enables crossings from the asynchronous reset pins of the library cells. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_const_source
cciOption.help: Disables reporting of crossings having constant input source even if reset/set can cause metastability. Default : false

cciOption.name: -through_const_enable_latch
cciOption.help: Enables Crossings generation through the Data/Set/Reset pins of a Latch provided Enable pin is tied to active value. <Default:data>

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of sequential drivers for crossing start point. Default: none

cciOption.name: -enable_ignore_path_hier_view
cciOption.help: This option enables support for hierarchical terminal in SGUM for cdc_false_path constraint correspodning to false_path_enable_hier_view SpyGlass paramter. Default : false

cciOption.name: -enable_recircmux_blocked_srcs
cciOption.help: This option enables crossing generation where RTL source flop of crossing is blocked by RTL recirculation MUX. Default : false

cciOption.name: -enable_quasi_detailed_reasoncode
cciOption.help: This option enables reporting of detailed reasoncode corresponding to the quasi-static provided by user on source or destination or on crossing path. Default : true.

cciOption.name: -enable_block_cdc_ignorepath
cciOption.help: Enables block migration of set_cdc_ignore_path command. true: to enable the migration for SAM and module scoping. false: to disable the migration. only_sam: to enable the migration only for SAM. Default : true

cciOption.name: -prefer_quasi_over_ignore_path
cciOption.help: Specify this switch to enable the preference of quasi-static signal on crossing path over set_cdc_ignore_path provided to ignore the crossing. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_data_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the data synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, data synchronization analysis is skipped for cdc crossing-paths, hence crossings will either be reported as unsynchronized or control-path synchronized

cciOption.name: -allow_complex_mux_recirc
cciOption.help: It allows additional combinational logic driven by destination domain signal within mux recirculation structure

cciOption.name: -skip_autoqual
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, tool auto-inferred NFF & UDS are not used as synchronizers for data synchronization analysis for cdc path crossings. Only user defined qualifiers are allowed as synchronizers for data synchronization analysis

cciOption.name: -allow_merged_qualifier
cciOption.help: gate at which source and the qualifier merges act as a new qualifier for other sources

cciOption.name: -incr
cciOption.help: It disables the creation of new qualifiers on the output of cells specified by -des_qual if an auto detected qualifier is not found

cciOption.name: -crossing
cciOption.help: Specify this argument to consider a crossing as synchronized if the user-defined qualifier specified by -des_qual defines a crossing output that contains only a single destination

cciOption.name: -des_qual
cciOption.help: It specifies the qualifier signal which blocks the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -des_enable_expr
cciOption.help: It specifies the enable expression signal which enables the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -des_enable_expr_validate
cciOption.help: It specifies the type of validation to be performed on the specified enable expression. Default: obj_reachable

cciOption.name: -des_qual_depth
cciOption.help: It specifies the maximum valid sequential depth of a qualifier. Default:3

cciOption.name: -ignore_des_qual
cciOption.help: It specifies the synchronizers that are not allowed as qualifiers

cciOption.name: -sync_point
cciOption.help: It defines legal synchronization points for blocking condition detection. Default : {and mux_select mux_recirc clock_gate sync_point_cell }

cciOption.name: -sync_point_cell
cciOption.help: It specifies modules or cells that are valid for blocking condition

cciOption.name: -sync_check_type
cciOption.help: It specifies the type of synchronizer check to be performed. Default: qual_only

cciOption.name: -sync_point_qualifier
cciOption.help: When set to "all", all the qualifier that can block the source on a blocking gate are reported Default : first

cciOption.name: -sync_point_select
cciOption.help: Specifies the location priority of the blocking gate with respect to source node of a crossing. Default:NONE

cciOption.name: -sync_point_report_limit
cciOption.help: Specified the maximum number of blocking gates on which source can be blocked. Default:5

cciOption.name: -and_or_based_cgc
cciOption.help: It allows AND/OR/NAND/NOR gates to be treated as valid Clock Gating cells for CGC based synchronization scheme

cciOption.name: -src_stable
cciOption.help: It allows user specified source qualifier and destination qualifier to synchronize data crossing if those are reaching the source and destination of crossing respectively

cciOption.name: -src_qual
cciOption.help: It specifies the source qualifier signal which blocks the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -src_qual_depth
cciOption.help: It specifies the maximum valid sequential depth of a source qualifier. Default:3

cciOption.name: -dual_qual_reqd
cciOption.help: It allows user to specify that both source and destination qualifier are required to synchronize data crossing

cciOption.name: -validate_on_domain
cciOption.help: It validates the user provided constraint on domains of provided from_clock and to_clock instead of clocks.

cciOption.name: -analyze_async_sources
cciOption.help: configures if synchornization checks needs to be performed for asynchronus sources(differrent clock domains) converging at same point. Default: false

cciOption.name: -dynamic_side_channel
cciOption.help: configures if deterministic gates in merged qual path with other inputs in destination domain are to be treated as buffers for dynamic sync analysis. default : true

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_prop_across_dest
cciOption.help: Configures if qualifiers are allowed to propagate across the destination of crossing paths, to perform synchronization analysis on other crossings. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_cascaded_cgc
cciOption.help: configures if cascaded clock gating cells are to be allowed during clock_gate synchornization scheme. Only cascaded lib-cell clock gate cells are supported under this option. Default:false

cciOption.name: -auto_syncrst_qual
cciOption.help: configures if auto-detected sync reset qualifier are to be ignored for synchronization checks. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_thru_cgc_gen_clock
cciOption.help: Allows qualifiers to be propagted through CGC cells, on the output of which generated clocks synchronous to destination domain are defined. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_sync_clocks_qual
cciOption.help: Enabling this configuration would allow qualifiers of clocks, synchronous to destination clocks for synchronization checks. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_qual_thru_upf
cciOption.help: configures if qualifiers to be propagated through logic insturmented using UPF files. Default:false

cciOption.name: -enable_syncpoint_reporting
cciOption.help: Enabling this configuration would report the blocking gate for synchronized crossings. Default : false

cciOption.name: -allow_all_syncpoint_for_user_qual
cciOption.help: When set to true, all types of sync gate are considered valid for user specified qualifiers. Default : true

cciOption.name: -disable_des_qual_validation
cciOption.help: When set to true, qualifiers specified using "-des_qual" option in the subsequent commands are not validated for the presence of valid clocks in the fanin-cone. Default : false

cciOption.name: -blocking_gate_modules
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of modules, the blocking-gates of which can use auto-inferred qualifiers for synchronization analysis.

cciOption.name: -blocking_gate_instances
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of module/lib-cell instances, the blocking-gates of which can use auto-inferred qualifiers for synchronization analysis.

cciOption.name: -enable_autoqual
cciOption.help: configure if auto-inferred qualifiers are allowed on a blocking gate or not

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_detailed_report
cciCmd.info: Configure the CDC-detailed-report.rpt

cciOption.name: -report_dnc_rtl_params
cciOption.help: Determines if a parameter is DNC or NON_DNC for abstraction and dumps the type in CDC-detailed-report.rpt. DNC stands for Do Not Care. If a parameter is DNC, then it does not affect abstraction. If NON_DNC, then it affects abstraction.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_formal
cciCmd.info: Configures formal CDC checks

cciOption.name: -maxdepth
cciOption.help: Sequential depth to analyze. Default: 10000

cciOption.name: -maxtime
cciOption.help: Time threshold per property (in sec) before giving up. Default: 10

cciOption.name: -propfile
cciOption.help: Select property file. Default: NA

cciOption.name: -hold_margin
cciOption.help: Specify hold margin for dataloss checks. Default: 1

cciOption.name: -slow_to_fast
cciOption.help: Specify the percentage of slow clock period to fast clock period for dataloss checks. Default: 100

cciOption.name: -design_cycle
cciOption.help: Verification cycle threshold for formal analysis. Default: 65535

cciOption.name: -bus_compress
cciOption.help: Enable bus compression for formal checks. Default: true

cciOption.name: -effective_bus_verif
cciOption.help: Enable efficient and complete verification of all bits of CDC DATAHOLD violations by combining multiple bits and verifying them in a single property. Default: false

cciOption.name: -dataloss
cciOption.help: Enable dataloss check for formal analysis from the list. Default: control_path

cciOption.name: -single_source
cciOption.help: Verify datahold and dataloss check only at one source for a crossing. Default: true

cciOption.name: -glitch
cciOption.help: Enable formal analysis for glitch checks on control path crossings. Default: gray

cciOption.name: -gray_signals
cciOption.help: Enable gray signals check for formal analysis. Default: true

cciOption.name: -reset_glitch
cciOption.help: Enable formal analysis for glitch checks on reset path.Default:false

cciOption.name: -init_mode
cciOption.help: Choose initialization mode for formal analysis. Default: auto

cciOption.name: -witness
cciOption.help: Choose witness generation for formal analysis. Default: userNets

cciOption.name: -msgmode
cciOption.value_help: <none | no_msg | audit | all | pass | fail | inconclusive>
cciOption.help: Specify the type of assertions (Failed, Inconclusive, Passed) that should be reported by CDC

cciOption.name: -dump_hybrid
cciOption.help: Specify the type of assertions for which cdc db assertions should be dumped

cciOption.name: -scheme
cciOption.help: Choose between Spyglass engines and VC Formal engines for in-built formal analysis. Default: spg

cciOption.name: -audit
cciOption.help: Explore the assertion checking opportunities in a design without performing the actual checks. Default: false

cciOption.name: -reset_glitch_latch_depth
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to set depth upto which drivers for latch input are to be created, Default : 2

cciOption.name: -ignore_reset_glitch_latch_loops
cciOption.help: When this configuration is set to true, assertions with latch loops are ignored during glitch analysis. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_glitch
cciCmd.info: Configures glitch checking criteria in case of multiple sources

cciOption.name: -unrelated
cciOption.help: Specify design objects which act as unrelated signals in the design

cciOption.name: -ignore_among_signals
cciOption.help: Specify design objects which can be source output pins, among which glitch due to multi-source convergence should not be reported

cciOption.name: -disable_assertions_db
cciOption.help: Disable AssertionDB generation for a constraint

cciOption.name: -multi_src_check_type
cciOption.value_help: none | unsync_noscheme | sync_data | unsync_data | sync_ctrl | unsync_ctrl | all
cciOption.help: Specify the types of sources that needs to be considered for glitch detection in case of multiple sources. Default : sync_ctrl unsync_ctrl

cciOption.name: -reconv_check_type
cciOption.value_help: none | unsync_noscheme | sync_data | unsync_data | sync_ctrl | unsync_ctrl | all
cciOption.help: Specify the types of sources that needs to be considered for glitch detection in case of reconverging sources. Default : sync_ctrl unsync_ctrl

cciOption.name: -glitch_type
cciOption.help: Specify the glitch path types that needs to be considered for glitch detection. Default : data

cciOption.name: -glitch_on_vck_port
cciOption.help: Enables checking for glitch on ports defined through configure_cdc_port -control

cciOption.name: -glitch_unate_analysis
cciOption.help: Specify whether to report glitch violation for same source re-convergence with same polarity. Default: false

cciOption.name: -glitch_on_unconstrained_src
cciOption.help: Enables checking for glitch on unconstrained ports and unconstrained bbox-pins present in the input cone of a destination

cciOption.name: -glitch_on_sync_src
cciOption.help: Specify this option to consider synchronous sources present in the input cone of destination signal for glitch checking

cciOption.name: -reconv_after_blocking_gate
cciOption.help: Specify whether to detect glitch due to reconvergence after the blocking gate of a data path glitch. Default: false

cciOption.name: -multi_source_unate_check
cciOption.help: Specify space seperated source design objects for which unate/binate analysis is to be performed for multi-source glitch analysis

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of source and destination information in Clock-Reset-All-Rules.rpt. Default: none

cciOption.name: -ignore_buf_inv
cciOption.help: Signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals' are propagated backward by ignoring buffers and inverters. Setting this configuration to 'false' will disable the back-propagataion across buffers and inverters. Default: true

cciOption.name: -disable_cdc_attrib_propagation
cciOption.help: Set this option to 'true' to disable the forward-propagation of signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals'. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_hiersoc_verification
cciCmd.info: Configures the HierSoC verification in cdc flow

cciOption.name: -enable_cdc_abstract_severity
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of abstract block violation tag with severity error if the block run has least one unresolved error

cciOption.name: -enable_cdc_abstract_zero_viol
cciOption.help: Enables abstract violation report file to dump all violation tags with severity error and warning even if the violation count is zero

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_integrity_checks
cciCmd.info: Enables Integrity checks based on user inputs. configure_integrity_checks and configure_cdc_integrity_checks are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -clock_race_thru_latch
cciOption.help: Prohibits propagation through latches. Default: false

cciOption.name: -clockgate_enable_glitch
cciOption.help: Enables SETUP_CLKGATE_GLITCH violation reporting if latch data is undriven or set as constant. Default: true

cciOption.name: -reset_deassert_value_as_sca
cciOption.help: While validating high and low usage of sync reset for INTEGRITY_SYNCRESET_HIGH_AND_LOW_USAGE tag, enable other sync resets acts as set_case_analysis in its de-assert value to block the validating current sync reset. Default: false

cciOption.name: -clockgate_allow_sdc_clock
cciOption.help: Enables INTEGRITY_CLOCKGATE_GLITCH violation reporting if new clock (create_clock/create_generated_clock) is defined at the output of AND/OR gate. Default: none

cciOption.name: -report_all_flops
cciOption.help: Enables to dump csv for other sequentials which are not reported with INTEGRITY_RESET_ASYNC_AND_SYNC_USAGE tag. Dump one csv per reset with reset name. Default: none

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.help: Enables the reporting of drivers information for the specified check. Default: none

cciOption.name: -extended_format
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types. Default: none

cciOption.name: -report_detail
cciOption.help: Specifies if all violations should be reported for each clock or only one violation should be reported per clock for Clock_check10/INTEGRITY_CLOCK_AS_NON_CLOCK tags. Default: all

cciOption.name: -report_derived_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies if INTEGRITY_RESET_ASYNC_AND_SYNC_USAGE or SETUP_RESET_DRIVING_NON_ASYNC_PIN tag should report for asynchronous derived resets. Default: none

cciOption.name: -clock_edge
cciOption.help: Reports INTEGRITY_CLOCKEDGE_UNEXPECTED violation for either clock posedge or clock negedge used in design. Default : positive. Set this parameter to negative to report clock descriptions for which a positive edge specified

cciOption.name: -clkedge_unexpected_viol_report_obj
cciOption.help: Use this option to set the type of end object for which INTEGRITY_CLOCKEDGE_UNEXPECTED violation should be reported. Default : flip-flop. Other possible values are black-box,latch,lib-cell and all.

cciOption.name: -report_all_fanouts_convergences
cciOption.help: When set to true, report INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violation for all instances of clock reconvergences. Else report only one instance of reconvergence per clock. Default: false.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_integrity_glitch
cciCmd.info: Enables glitch check on clock paths based on user inputs.

cciOption.name: -unate_analysis
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report glitch violation for same source re-convergence with same polarity. Default : false

cciOption.name: -path_type
cciOption.help: Specify this option to apply the command on the type of path to be considered for glitch detection. By default, the command is applicable for clock path glitch

cciOption.name: -report_all_glitchy_gates
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report all reconv gates as list in single violation. This option is applicable for INTEGRITY_CLOCK_ENABLE_GLITCH tag. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_all_destination
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report all destination as list in single violation or individual destinations in separate violation. This option is applicable when specified with option -report_dest_list. Default value is 'false' for clock path glitch tag(INTEGRITY_CLOCK_ENABLE_GLITCH), and 'true' for reset path glitch tag(INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH)

cciOption.name: -report_dest_list
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report the destinations as list in single violation or individual in multiple violations. This option is applicable when specified with option -report_all_destination. Default value is 'true' for clock path glitch tag(INTEGRITY_CLOCK_ENABLE_GLITCH), and 'false' for reset path glitch tag(INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH)

cciOption.name: -ignore_among_signals
cciOption.help: Specify design objects which can be source output pins, among which glitch due to multi-source convergence should not be reported. This option is applicable for INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH tag

cciOption.name: -strict_glitch_analysis
cciOption.help: Specify if glitches due to reconvergence of same source with mixed unateness should be reported or not. This option is applicable for INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH tag. Default : none

cciOption.name: -ignore_buf_inv
cciOption.help: Signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals' are propagated backward by ignoring buffers and inverters. Setting this configuration to 'false' will disable the back-propagataion across buffers and inverters. Default: true

cciOption.name: -disable_cdc_attrib_propagation
cciOption.help: Set this option to 'true' to disable the forward-propagation of signals specified in option 'ignore_among_signals'. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi
cciOption.help: By default, the quasi-static signals are ignored for glitch analysis. Set this option to allow quasi-static signals for glitch analysis in reset path. (Used by rules Ar_glitch03 and tag INTGRITY_RESET_GLITCH).

cciOption.name: -mux_sca_analysis
cciOption.help: By default, the reset path glitch checks honor user-defined set_case_analysis on the mux select. Set this option to true, to not honor user defined set_case_analysis commands on mux-select(Used by Ar_glitch03 and INTEGRITY_RESET_PATH tags). Default: false

cciOption.name: -check_only_reconv
cciOption.help: By default, both multi-source glitch and same source reconvergence glitch are reported in the reset path. Set this option to true to report glitch due to same source reconvergence only. (Used by Ar_glitch03 and INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH tags). Default false.

cciOption.name: -start_points
cciOption.help: Specifies list of start points for glitch analysis on reset path. Specified start points should be a top level output port, or input pin/port of a black-box or a library-cell. This option is valid only when specified with -path_type reset. Used by rules Ar_glitch03 and INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH

cciOption.name: -glitch_type
cciOption.help: Specify this option to set type of glitch affecting design objects specified in option -start_points. This option is valid only when -start_points option is specified along with -path_type reset. Used by rules Ar_glitch03 and INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH. Default: both

cciOption.name: -report_reconv_glitch_per_src
cciOption.help: By default, both multi-source glitch and same source reconvergence glitch are reported in the reset path. Set this option to true to report glitch due to same source reconvergence only. Also, the violations are reported source-wise. (Used by INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH tags). Default false.

cciOption.name: -report_per_cone_reconv_glitch
cciOption.help: When the option report_reconv_glitch_src is enabled, all the destinations in different reset cones are reported together as single violation. Set this option to true to report the destinations in different reset cones as separate violations. This option works only when the options '-report_reconv_glitch_src' and '-report_all_destination' are enabled. The option does not work when option '-report_dest_list' is enabled (Used by INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH tags). Default false.

cciOption.name: -report_glitch_type
cciOption.help: By default, only critical/unsafe glitches are reported in the reset path. Set this option to all for reporting both non-critical/safe and critical/unsafe glitches in the reset-path. (Used by rule INTEGRITY_RESET_GLITCH). Default: unsafe

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_internal_crossing
cciCmd.info: Enables Crossings on the source clock pin and the destination clock pin of the libcell provided

cciOption.name: -src_clk_pin
cciOption.help: specify the source clock pin name

cciOption.name: -dest_clk_pin
cciOption.help: specify the destination clock pin name

cciOption.name: -libcell_inst
cciOption.help: specify the libcell instance

cciOption.name: -tag
cciOption.help: specify tags for reporting

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_multiflop
cciCmd.info: This command is used to configure reporting of multi-flop chains

cciOption.name: -ignore_modules
cciOption.help: If multi-flop chain is present in module specified, its violation will be reported as warning

cciOption.name: -check_diff_hierarchy
cciOption.help: Set this configuration to true, if multi-flop chains with different hierarchy of destination and synchronizer flop are to be reported as warning

cciOption.name: -enable_merge_vector
cciOption.help: If this configuration is set to true, bus merging will be enabled while reporting multi-flop violations. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_netlist_busmerging
cciCmd.info: Specifies netlist bus-merging attributes

cciOption.name: -start_delimiter
cciOption.help: Start delimiter for a netlist bus

cciOption.name: -end_delimiter
cciOption.help: End delimiter for a netlist bus

cciOption.name: -add_delimiter
cciOption.help: Add current pair of delimiters to the allowed delimiters' list

cciOption.name: -suffix
cciOption.value_help: <space separated list of netlist bus's suffixes>
cciOption.help: list of suffixes for netlist buses in the design

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_nff_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the multi-flop synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: It disables the auto detection of multi-flop synchronizers

cciOption.name: -allow_combo_logic
cciOption.help: used to configure which non-static combinational logic is to be allowed between source and destination flop for multi-flop synchronizer detection. Default: no

cciOption.name: -depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential depth to be considered as valid multi-flop synchronizer. The depth will be considered value specified and above (depth 1 indicates sequential depth of 1 or more to be considered as valid multiflop synchronizer). Default value: 2

cciOption.name: -allowed_modules
cciOption.help: Restricts NFF synchronizer detection to specified modules

cciOption.name: -uds_modules
cciOption.help: specifies user defined synchronizer cells

cciOption.name: -modules
cciOption.help: This option is used to provide modules (uds/monitor/ignore_latch) to the tool using -type option(mandatory with -modules). type monitor specifies modules for which tool detected nff structures need to be monitored. type uds specifies modules which act as uds/synchronizer cells. An unused uds violation is thrown of constraints for which no monitored/uds crossing is found.ignore_latch options specifies the latch modules/instances to be ignored while traversing from crossing destination.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: This option is used to specify type of module (provided using -module option). This can be also be used with -to_obj option to specify instances whose crossings need to be monitored. See -module option for more details. Default : uds.

cciOption.name: -ignore_multi_domain_sources
cciOption.help: setting it to true will consider a destination for multi-flop synchronizer detection, even if multiple domains srcs are driving the destination. Default:yes

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi_static
cciOption.help: setting it allows combinational logic between the synchronizer flip-flops if the combinational logic is probable buffer path as side inputs are quasi-static. Default:no

cciOption.name: -allow_latch
cciOption.help: setting it allows latch in multi-flop synchronizer chain. Default:flop_chain

cciOption.name: -allow_half_sync
cciOption.help: configure flops with inverted clock-polarity for NFF detection. Default:unset

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clk_period
cciOption.help: configure flops with different clock periods for NFF detection. Default:true

cciOption.name: -detect_potential_synchronizers
cciOption.help: Detect potential synchronizers in allowed modules. Default:no

cciOption.name: -remove_redundant_logic
cciOption.help: Reduce redundant logic in nff chain Default : true

cciOption.name: -allow_parallel_synchronizers
cciOption.help: Allow nffs which have parallel synchronizer flops after destination to be marked as valid synchronizer structures Default : false

cciOption.name: -suppress_unobservable
cciOption.help: Type of crossing required to be suppressed. This option accepts a list. By default, no value is provided.

cciOption.name: -strict
cciOption.help: Type of method to detect unobservable object

cciOption.name: -auto_detect_sync_cell
cciOption.help: Type of libcell inside which NFF detection needs to be done. Default:none

cciOption.name: -data_pin_connectivity
cciOption.help: Configuration for connectivity of data pin of a valid synchronizer.Default:no_check.

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clock_net
cciOption.help: Configures NFF detection of destinations having different clock nets than the corresponding synchronizer flop. If set to false, such structures would be marked invalid NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_full_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration outputs the name of complete nff chain in synchronizer_flop_chain attribute. default:false

cciOption.name: -same_hier_level
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to specify common hierarchy level within which the NFF flops should reside.This will limit the number of hierarchical levels. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -src_count
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to limit the number of sources of a destination to be considered valid for NFF or UDS analysis. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if quasi gate is allowed in chain. Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_asyncrst_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if asyncrst gate is allowed in chain.Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_buf_equiv_logic
cciOption.help: Configuration is used to specify if buffer equivalent logic is allowed in the detection of NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_insufficient_depth_nff
cciOption.help: Detectes NFF chains which do not meet the user depth criteira. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_dest_recirc
cciOption.help: When this configuration to true, destination fanout which is recirculating back to destination is not considered as a meta-fanout. Default:false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_port
cciCmd.info: Configures ports for CDC analysis

cciOption.name: -control
cciOption.help: Specifies the port(s) will be connected to a synchronizer.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_power_aware
cciCmd.info: Configures to consider Isolation Latch cell as Sequential or Combinatorial

cciOption.name: -isolation_latch
cciOption.help: Consider Isolation Latch cell as Sequential or Combinatorial

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_property
cciCmd.info: This command configures the write_cdc_property. It must be specified before check_* command.

cciOption.name: -preserve_glitch_model
cciOption.help: Use this option to preserve the formal glitch models to dump resepective sva.[Default: false]

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_rca
cciCmd.info: configuration options for CDC RCA flow

cciOption.name: -tag
cciOption.help: Specify the tag

cciOption.name: -minimum_dest_signal_count
cciOption.help: Specify Minimum Unique Destination Bus [SRC_HIGH_FANOUT] (Default:20)

cciOption.name: -minimum_src_signal_count
cciOption.help: Specify Minimum Unique Source Bus Count [DEST_HIGH_FANIN] (Default:20)

cciOption.name: -async_dest_signal_atleast_one
cciOption.help: Flag violation if atleast one Unsync Crossing present from source [SRC_HIGH_FANOUT] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -async_dest_signal_all
cciOption.help: Flag violation only if NO sync crossings present from source [SRC_HIGH_FANOUT] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -async_src_signal_atleast_one
cciOption.help: Flag violation if atleast one unsync crossing present to destination [DEST_HIGH_FANIN] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -async_src_signal_all
cciOption.help: Flag violation only if NO sync crossings present to destination [DEST_HIGH_FANIN] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -async_clk_domain_atleast_one
cciOption.help: Flag violation if atleast one asynchronous clock domain present [PORT/BBOXPIN_CONSTRAINT] (Default:ON)

cciOption.name: -async_clk_domain_only_one
cciOption.help: Flag violation if ONLY one asynchronous clock domain present [PORT/BBOXPIN_CONSTRINT] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -async_crossings_only
cciOption.help: Only consider count of unsync crossings to flag an instance as high fanout / fanin [SRC/DST_INST_HIGH_FANOUT/FANIN] (Default:ON)

cciOption.name: -async_crossing_atleast_one
cciOption.help: Consider instance as high fanout / fanin if it contains atleast one unsync crossing [SRC/DST_INST_HIGH_FANOUT/FANIN] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -minimum_crossing_outside_inst
cciOption.help: Specify minimum crossing count outside instance to be considered as high fanout / fanin [SRC/DST_INST_HIGH_FANOUT/FANIN] (Default:1000)

cciOption.name: -exclude_datapath_partial
cciOption.help: Exclude Data Path Partial crossings [ASYNC_CLOCKPAIR] (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -potential_default_depth
cciOption.help: Set potential default qualifier depth to check for possible synchronization [QUALIFIER_DEFAULT_SEQDEPTH] (Default:3)

cciOption.name: -ignore_fanin_signal
cciOption.help: Provide string to match to ignore fanin signal paths on the next run. [Applicable only for DEBUG_CDC_FANIN_SIGNAL_COMMON/DEBUG_CDC_FANIN_QUAL_DIFF_DOMAIN/DEBUG_CDC_FANIN_QUAL_SAME_DOMAIN]

cciOption.name: -testlogic_filter_exp
cciOption.help: Provide string to match to check TEST LOGIC Paths [DEBUG_CDC_TEST_LOGIC*] (Default expressions: TEST, DFT, SCAN, BIST, TCK)

cciOption.name: -group_testlogic_violations
cciOption.help: Group All TESTLOGIC_SOURCE / TESTLOGIC_DESTINATION violations into one (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -group_memlogic_violations
cciOption.help: Group all MEMLOGIC_SOURCE / MEMLOGIC_DESTINATION violations into one (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -memlogic_bus_size_threshold
cciOption.help: Set the threshold to check bus sizes for filtering MEMLOGIC objects (Default:1024)

cciOption.name: -uncovered_viols_report_path
cciOption.help: Directory where uncovered effect violation information will be dumped

cciOption.name: -include_rstviols_qual_rc
cciOption.help: includes qualifier violations for Reset(Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -groupby_dest_domain
cciOption.help: Group All port constraint violations based on Dest Clock domain (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -hotspot_view
cciOption.help: Enables quick analysis of cause with high impact and re-run clustering iteratively in same session to cover all effect & causes in subsequent RCA analysis. (Default:OFF)

cciOption.name: -qualname_filter_exp
cciOption.help: Provide string to match to check potential qualifier paths [DEBUG_CDC_QUALIFIER_POTENTIAL] (Default expressions: SYNC)

cciOption.name: -fanin_depth
cciOption.help: Set the depth level for fanin analysis (Default:3)

cciOption.name: -dest_threshold
cciOption.help: Set the threshold count of dest to consider for violation(Default:8)

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_read_project
cciCmd.info: Set configurations for sg_read_project command

cciOption.name: -disable_tags_from_moresimple_rpt
cciOption.help: VC SG tag(s) which should be skipped from being dumped in moresimple.rpt

cciOption.name: -analyze_options
cciOption.help: Specify additional options to be passed to analyze command

cciOption.name: -elaborate_options
cciOption.help: Specify additional options to be passed to elaborate command

cciOption.name: -analyze_vcs_options
cciOption.help: Specify additional options to be passed to '-vcs' option of analyze command

cciOption.name: -elaborate_vcs_options
cciOption.help: Specify additional options to be passed to -vcs' option of elaborate command

cciOption.name: -translate_waive_to_cdc_ignore_path
cciOption.help: Specifies to translate SG 'waive' command to 'set_cdc_ignore_path'. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_reason_code
cciCmd.info: Sets the type of CDC reason code

cciOption.name: -code
