cciOption.help: Specify the reason code

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Specify the type

cciOption.name: -hide
cciOption.help: Hides reason code information in report

cciOption.name: -unhide
cciOption.help: Shows reason code information in report

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_sam_constraints
cciCmd.info: Use this command to configure design abstraction in VC SpyGlass CDC flow. It controls the preservation/application of constraints.

cciOption.name: -cmd
cciOption.help: Commands to be migrated.

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enable/disable specific configuration for given command. Default: true

cciOption.name: -read
cciOption.help: Enable reading for given commands. Default: true

cciOption.name: -write
cciOption.help: Enable writing for given commands. Default: true

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_setup_blackbox
cciCmd.info: Configure parameters for blackbox modeling and setup. configure_setup_blackbox and configure_cdc_setup_blackbox are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -ignore_module_type
cciOption.help: Specifies to criteria to ignore modeling and CDC analysis for blackboxes

cciOption.name: -ignore_module_names
cciOption.help: Specifies list of module names for which Setup_blackbox01 does not need to be reported

cciOption.name: -report_abstract_module_coverage
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report coverage of abstracted module under setup_blackbox01. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_setup_check
cciCmd.info: Configures parameters values for setup related checks.configure_setup_check and configure_cdc_setup_check are aliases of each other.

cciOption.name: -report_latch
cciOption.help: Report violations on latches

cciOption.name: -report_reset_undecl_on_const_clock
cciOption.help: Report unreset sequentials whose clock pin is receiving a constant value

cciOption.name: -filter_reset_undecl_on_quasi_static
cciOption.help: Enables the SETUP_RESET_UNDECL to not report violations when the nes are constrained as quasi static

cciOption.name: -report_clock_glitch_on_hanging_net
cciOption.help: Report SETUP_CLOCK_GLITCH with hanging net destination

cciOption.name: -report_quasi_static_clock_as_constant
cciOption.help: Report quasi-static clock pins as constant instead of undeclared

cciOption.name: -report_only_sca_violations
cciOption.help: Report SETUP_*_CONSTANT only if they are caused by a set_case_analysis

cciOption.name: -clock_on_ports
cciOption.help: Report clock overlaps/convergence on output ports

cciOption.name: -reset_on_ports
cciOption.help: Report reset overlaps/convergence on output ports

cciOption.name: -same_domain_overlap
cciOption.help: Report overlaps of same-domain clocks in SGUM

cciOption.name: -clock_undecl_rca
cciOption.help: Analyze the reason for unclocked pins

cciOption.name: -check_port_setup
cciOption.help: Ports on which to checks SETUP_PORT

cciOption.name: -report_propagated_coverage
cciOption.help: Reports ports and blockbox pins as constrained due to propagation of clock, reset. quasi static and constant signals. Default: true

cciOption.name: -no_unate_reconv
cciOption.help: Report clock/reset convergence only if both positive & negative polarities converge

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_sequential
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP and SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP violations only if clock is reaching any sequential element

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_data_path
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED and INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violations on data path

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_constrained_mux
cciOption.help: Report or Supress the reporting of SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED and SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED When mux select is constant. Default is true.

cciOption.name: -report_clock_reconvergence_on_mux
cciOption.help: Reports INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violations on Muxs

cciOption.name: -check_reset_for_constclock
cciOption.help: Reports the status of set and preset pins of those sequentials whose clock pin is tied to constant value

cciOption.name: -report_all_seq_for_assert_missing
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_RESET_ASSERT_MISSING violation for all sequentials

cciOption.name: -annotate_reset_assertion
cciOption.help: Annotates the reset value for SETUP_RESET_ASSERT_MISSING violations

cciOption.name: -report_all_asyncreset_combo
cciOption.help: Report multiple violations for the same input cone driven by combinational logic when the same input cone is driving multiple flops

cciOption.name: -report_reset_path_mux
cciOption.help: Report a violation when the asynchronous set/reset pins of a sequential element are driven by mux

cciOption.name: -clock_usage
cciOption.help: Specify signal types to be reported for non-clock usage

cciOption.name: -async_reset_usage
cciOption.help: Specify signal types to be reported for non-reset usage

cciOption.name: -all_converging_clocks
cciOption.help: Reports all the clocks converging on a mux

cciOption.name: -ignore_ports_for_inferdom
cciOption.help: Ignores domain specified on output port during auto-inference of domain for input ports and vica versa

cciOption.name: -report_clkglitch_on_io
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_CLOCK_GLITCH violations on those inout ports where user clock is defined

cciOption.name: -report_glitch_on_bbox
cciOption.help: Report clock glitch driving only black box

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_genclk
cciOption.help: Report clock overwrite if geneated clock is driven by any other clock

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_to_genclk
cciOption.help: Report clock overlaps if overlapping points drives geneated clock

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.value_help: <none | clockUndecl | libCellComboDrivenAsyncPin | resetConstActive | resetConstInactive | resetAssertMissing | inputMultiClkLoad | outputMultiClkDriver | inputMultiClkLoadInferredDomain | outputMultiClkDriverInferredDomain | all>
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of drivers information for the specified check. Default: none

cciOption.name: -latch_as_seq
cciOption.help: Specify as true to consider latch output as generated_clock for Clock_info01 rule in Spyglass like flow. Default: false

cciOption.name: -show_constant_source
cciOption.help: Show the type of constant source is driving the constant value for clock and data constant tag/rules. Default: false

cciOption.name: -max_reset_const_active_seq_count
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum number of SETUP_RESET_CONSTANT_ACTIVE violations for each constant reset source. Default: 3

cciOption.name: -report_port_as_partial
cciOption.help: Controls the reporting of a port as partially constrained. Default: all

cciOption.name: -soft_reset_through_mux_select_non_const
cciOption.help: Allows to control soft resets identification in the fanin of mux select line when at least one mux input is non-constant signal. Default: always

cciOption.name: -report_soft_reset_on_ports
cciOption.help: Allows to report primary ports (input/inout) which are not constrained as resets, as soft resets if they are merging to a reset path through a combinational logic. Default: false

cciOption.name: -reset_undecl_fanin_reset_check
cciOption.help: Reports user resets that are in the fanin of unconstrained RST/SET pin with SETUP_RESET_UNDECL tag. Default: false

cciOption.name: -reset_undecl_fanin_seq_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while searching fanin resets for SETUP_RESET_UNDECL tag. This impacts only when -reset_undecl_fanin_reset_check option is true. Values between 0 and 100 are allowed. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -soft_reset_analysis_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while doing soft reset analysis. Terminology for calculating required depth; latch represents depth 0.5, flop represents depth 1, complex libcell represents depth 2. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -generated_reset_master_search_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while searching master reset in create_generated_reset command. -1 for infinite. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -reset_sim_active_value
cciOption.help: Allows to perform simulation by applying active value on all reset and use the simulated value as active value for reset constraints generated on output ports during abstraction. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_driving_reset_pin_count
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to report the number of reset pin count that each reset is driving with SETUP_RESET_PROPAGATED tag. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_port_as_constrained
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report clock ports/pins as fully constrianed when clock is reaching to them. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_multiclkload_for_inferred_singledom
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to false then the violation for the tag SETUP_INPUT_CONSTRAINED_MULTICLK_LOAD would not be reported for ports on which only single domain is inferred by the tool. Default : true

cciOption.name: -report_clock_undecl_on_blocked_pin
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to true then the violation for the tag SETUP_CLOCK_UNDECL would be reported when clock is blocked on the complex sequential library cell clock pin. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_crm_load
cciOption.help: Disables clock relationship matrix loading. Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_from_abstract_block
cciOption.help: Enables the inference of potential clock/reset sources starting from abstract block input clock/reset pins. This would impact VC SG rules Clock_info01/Reset_info01. In VC, this would impacet tag SETUP_RESET_INFER. Default: none

cciOption.name: -check_constraints_on_pin
cciOption.help: When set to yes , then Tag Setup_port01/Setup_black01 would check on Port/Pin and not get constraint from connected net.

cciOption.name: -report_user_defined_fanin_nets
cciOption.help: When this option is set to true, user defined fan in nets are reported for tags INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE, SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_multiclkdriver_for_inferred_singledom
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to false then the violation for the tag SETUP_OUTPUT_CONSTRAINED_MULTICLK_DRIVER would not be reported for ports on which only single domain is inferred by the tool. Default : true

cciOption.name: -report_single_overwrite_violation_per_clock_root
cciOption.help: Report only one violation if there are multiple clocks defined on the same clock root and which are overlap. Default : false

cciOption.name: -param_mismatch
cciOption.help: Checks parameters mismatch between module and its corresponding current_design.

cciOption.name: -non_default_abstract
cciOption.help: Generate and consume abstract model in non-default style, without def_param.

cciOption.name: -check_clock_path_module_glitch
cciOption.help: Specify list of module in clock path on which you want to perform glitch analysis

cciOption.name: -report_all_setup_data_constant_violation
cciOption.help: Set this to true to report all SETUP_DATA_CONSTANT violation without checking set and reset status, By Default these two cases are not reported. 1. data pin constant value 1 with reset 2.data pin constant value 0 with set. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_moduleglitch_all_inst
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to all report issue for all instances of a user specify having glitch issue for tag SETUP_CLOCK_MODULEGLITCH. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_moduleglitch_all_pins
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to all report issue for all pins per instance of a user specify having glitch issue for tag SETUP_CLOCK_MODULEGLITCH. Default : false

cciOption.name: -enable_partial_constraint_for_bbox_libcells
cciOption.help: Set this option to enable partial constraint feature for bbox and libcells, By Default bbox and libcell only support unconstraint or fully constraint. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_setup_libcell
cciCmd.info: Configures parameters for libcell setup and modeling. configure_setup_libcell and configure_cdc_setup_libcell are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -user_analysis_module
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of those library cells which are required to be analyzed

cciOption.name: -unconstr_libcell_pin_synchronized
cciOption.help: Libcell input and inout pins which are not associated with any real clock would be assumed synchronized inside the libcell

cciOption.name: -auto_infer_internal_pins
cciOption.help: By Default, Internal Pins are not modelled for Libcell. Set this option to true to enable Libcell Modeling for Interal Pins. default false.

cciOption.name: -dump_constraint
cciOption.value_help: <default | timing_arc_missing | timing_arc_specified | pin_unconnected | pin_constant | pin_quasi | all>
cciOption.help: Generate constraints for lib-cell pins. Default: 'timing_arc_missing timing_arc_specified'

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_sg_hier
cciCmd.info: Configures the spyglass like hierarchical analysis in VC Spyglass Hierarchical SoC Flow

cciOption.name: -cdc_enable_new_validate_flow
cciOption.help: Enables or Disables the spyglass-like hierarchical validation checks

cciOption.name: -cdc_read_constr_abs_model
cciOption.help: Enables or Disables the consumption of spyglass-like abstract models

cciOption.name: -enable_sg_abstract_errors
cciOption.help: Configures to report spyglass abstract model constraint parsing errors

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_sgwaiver
cciCmd.info: Configures the waiver transformation from SG to VCUM

cciOption.name: -tag
cciOption.help: VC tag(s) on which the transformation should be applied

cciOption.name: -field
cciOption.help: Field(s) of the tag(s) on which the transformation should be applied. Field name should be the display name.

cciOption.name: -compare
cciOption.value_help: <ignore | exact | bus_name | diffdir_bus | BboxLib_Scalar | BboxLib_Vector | bufinv_fanout | bufinv_fanin | pin_fanin>
cciOption.help: Determines the transformation(s) to be applied on the tag field(s)

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_smart_netlist
cciCmd.info: Command to configure the CDC Smart Netlist flow. Should be used before design read.

cciOption.name: -flow_type
cciOption.help: Specify the Smart Netlist flow type at RTL

cciOption.name: -diff_field_priority
cciOption.help: Specify the file path to catagorize the priority of debug fields

cciOption.name: -diff_ref_run
cciOption.help: Specify the RTL design database directory with which the Netlist design database needs to be compared

cciOption.name: -obj_translation_scope
cciOption.help: Specify to generate mapping for hierarchical ports for which mapping is missing in the mapping file. Default value is none.

cciOption.name: -include_rtl_viol
cciOption.value_help: <all|only_rtl|same_as_rtl|none>. By default both 'only_rtl' and 'same_as_rtl' category violations are filtered and not reported in Netlist run
cciOption.help: Specify the type of CDC RTL violations that need to be reported in Netlist run

cciOption.name: -dump_unmapped_obj
cciOption.help: Specify to dump unmapped objects with their original name as mapped name. By default, unmapped objects would be dumped as unmapped signal only. When set to true, the original name of the unmapped signal will be dumped as mapped name

cciOption.name: -crdb_file
cciOption.help: Specify the Siloti generated crdb file to generate enhance mapping and improved QOR at Netlist run

cciOption.name: -crdb_map_file
cciOption.help: Specify the crdb mapping file

cciOption.name: -crdb_scope_map_file
cciOption.help: Specify the crdb scopes mapping file

cciOption.name: -formality_map_file
cciOption.help: Specify the Formality mapping file generated in Siloti style

cciOption.name: -auto_perform
cciOption.help: Specify to disable auto loading of translated constraints, translated waivers or differential database generated at RTL during Netlist run

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_static
cciCmd.info: Configures quasi-statics for CDC analysis

cciOption.name: -prop_num_sequential
cciOption.help: Allows quasi static signal to propagate beyond sequential elements. The default value is 0. By default, the quasi static signals do not propagate beyond sequential elements.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_userpath_analysis
cciCmd.info: This command is used to configure the userpath analysis

cciOption.name: -enable_setup_hold_mcp
cciOption.help: When set to true, this configuration disables all the MCP paths with no hold set back. Default:false.

cciOption.name: -enable_async_paths
cciOption.help: Setting this to true will enable analysis for all the MCP paths where the source clocks and destination clocks are asynchronous in nature. Default:false.

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: If specified, userpath analysis of given type will be enabled

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_userpath_data_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the data synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the data crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of data crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: When this option is specified, data synchronization analysis is skipped for cdc crossing-paths, hence crossings will either be reported as unsynchronized or control-path synchronized

cciOption.name: -des_enable_expr
cciOption.help: It specifies the enable expression signal which enables the source of data crossing

cciOption.name: -disable_des_qual_validation
cciOption.help: When set to true, qualifiers specified using "-des_qual" option in the subsequent commands are not validated for the presence of valid clocks in the fanin-cone. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_userpath_nff_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the multi-flop synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -from_obj
cciOption.help: List of source objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj
cciOption.help: List of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_obj_types
cciOption.help: List of type of destination objects of control crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: It disables the auto detection of multi-flop synchronizers

cciOption.name: -allow_combo_logic
cciOption.help: used to configure which non-static combinational logic is to be allowed between source and destination flop for multi-flop synchronizer detection. Default: no

cciOption.name: -depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential depth to be considered as valid multi-flop synchronizer. The depth will be considered value specified and above (depth 1 indicates sequential depth of 1 or more to be considered as valid multiflop synchronizer). Default value: 2

cciOption.name: -allowed_modules
cciOption.help: Restricts NFF synchronizer detection to specified modules

cciOption.name: -uds_modules
cciOption.help: specifies user defined synchronizer cells

cciOption.name: -ignore_multi_domain_sources
cciOption.help: setting it to true will consider a destination for multi-flop synchronizer detection, even if multiple domains srcs are driving the destination. Default:yes

cciOption.name: -allow_latch
cciOption.help: setting it allows latch in multi-flop synchronizer chain. Default:flop_chain

cciOption.name: -allow_half_sync
cciOption.help: configure flops with inverted clock-polarity for NFF detection. Default:unset

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clk_period
cciOption.help: configure flops with different clock periods for NFF detection. Default:true

cciOption.name: -remove_redundant_logic
cciOption.help: Reduce redundant logic in nff chain Default : true

cciOption.name: -auto_detect_sync_cell
cciOption.help: Type of libcell inside which NFF detection needs to be done. Default:none

cciOption.name: -allow_diff_clock_net
cciOption.help: Configures NFF detection of destinations having different clock nets than the corresponding synchronizer flop. If set to false, such structures would be marked invalid NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_full_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration outputs the name of complete nff chain in synchronizer_flop_chain attribute. default:false

cciOption.name: -same_hier_level
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to specify common hierarchy level within which the NFF flops should reside.This will limit the number of hierarchical levels. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -src_count
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to limit the number of sources of a destination to be considered valid for NFF or UDS analysis. Minimum value is 1. Default:-1.

cciOption.name: -allow_quasi_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if quasi gate is allowed in chain. Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_asyncrst_gate_in_chain
cciOption.help: This configuration is used to configure if asyncrst gate is allowed in chain.Default:false.

cciOption.name: -allow_buf_equiv_logic
cciOption.help: Configuration is used to specify if buffer equivalent logic is allowed in the detection of NFFs. Default : true

cciOption.name: -detect_insufficient_depth_nff
cciOption.help: Detectes NFF chains which do not meet the user depth criteira. Default:false

cciOption.name: -allow_dest_recirc
cciOption.help: When this configuration to true, destination fanout which is recirculating back to destination is not considered as a meta-fanout. Default:false

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_validation
cciCmd.info: Configures validation checks for constraint based abstract model. configure_hier_validation and configure_cdc_validation are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -express
cciOption.help: Enables low noise and low effort validation check for constraint based hier SoC flow

cciOption.name: -reduce_pessimism
cciOption.help: Ignores reporting of validation checks in the specified conditions

cciOption.name: -extended_format
cciOption.value_help: <none | case | combo | data | quasi | clock | reset | virtual | all>
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.value_help: <none | case | combo | data | quasi | clock | reset | virtual | all>
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types

cciOption.name: -traverse_combo
cciOption.help: Enables traversal through combo path or assume path when -analog -testbus switches are specified in apply_attribute

cciOption.name: -group_port_names
cciOption.help: Group related violations together for Clock Domain Mismatch

cciOption.name: -abstract_model
cciOption.help: Type of abstract models for which the command is applicable

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enables Validation of specified list

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disables Validation of specified list

cciOption.name: -translate_clocks
cciOption.help: Translates create_clock/create_generated_clock using refclock

cciOption.name: -report_unconstrained_sam_objects
cciOption.help: Reports the validation mismatch for unconstrained SAM internal objects

cciOption.name: -enable_mismatch_reason_column
cciOption.help: Specifies mismatch reason between abstract block and top-level design. Default: false

cciOption.name: -show_constant_source
cciOption.help: Use this option to specify the constant source type as SCA, RTL, or MIXED

cciOption.name: -sync_analysis
cciOption.help: Use this option to perform sync analysis in Data-Path Domain Validation checks

cciOption.name: -strict_clock_domain_validation
cciOption.help: Enables strict validation of clock domains. When set to true, a top level clock pair is considered synchronous if any one of the pairs of user-level-clocks is synchronous.

cciOption.name: -enable_sam_internalobj_validation
cciOption.help: Specifies to enable the validation checks on internal SAM objects. Under this option, only the Clock and Reset validation mismatch are performed on the internal SAM objects. Default value of this option is 'true'.

cciOption.name: -allow_unclocked_sources
cciOption.help: Specify to treat unclocked object as valid source for combo validation on output ports. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_hanging_sources
cciOption.help: Specify to treat hanging object as valid source for combo validation on output ports. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_quasi_sources
cciOption.help: Specify the option value 'false' to not to treat quasi-static signals as valid sources for combo validation on output ports. Default: true

cciOption.name: -disable_for_combo_yes
cciOption.help: Specify to disable the combo validation checks for output ports constrained with combo attribute value 'yes'. Default: false

cciOption.name: -ignore_top_quasi
cciOption.help: By default, the validation mismatch is ignored when a quasi-signal reaches a block port and quasi_static is specified in the -reduce_pessimism option. Use this option to not honor quasi_static pessimism reduction for specified mismatch types. Default: none.

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_verbose_report
cciCmd.info: Generate verbose report for the provided tag

cciOption.name: -tag
cciOption.help: Specifies violation tag whose verbose report is to be generated

cciOption.name: -field
cciOption.help: Specifies list of extra fields corresponding to a violation tag which are to be generated

cciCmd.name: configure_cdc_waive_block_violation
cciCmd.info: This constraint is used to specify modules/instances which needs to be considered for ContainerModule field population and hence violation lying inside it needs to be ignored.

cciOption.name: -modules
cciOption.help: List of module names for every instance which needs to be considered for ContainerModule field population and hence violation lying inside it needs to be ignored.

cciOption.name: -instances
cciOption.help: List of instance names which needs to be considered for ContainerModule field population and hence violation lying inside it needs to be ignored.

cciOption.name: -container_module_instance
cciOption.help: This field configures the blocks to be considered for determining the correct container module/instance.

cciCmd.name: configure_clock_reset_tree
cciCmd.info: Configures the Clock/Reset Tree view generated by generate_clock_reset_tree

cciOption.name: -ignore_bbox_loads
cciOption.help: Ignores blackboxes from sequential loads and TFO count

cciOption.name: -ignore_bbox_signals
cciOption.help: Ignores signals originating inside a blackbox for mux selects and clock enables

cciOption.name: -include_intermediate_cones
cciOption.help: Include clock cones driving no sequential logic

cciOption.name: -count_vector_bits
cciOption.help: Count each bit of vector flops/latches separately for Sequential Count and Total fanout calculations

cciOption.name: -default
cciOption.help: Reset all configuration settings to default values

cciOption.name: -include_non_clk_rst_mux
cciOption.help: Consider all muxes as candidates for mux-select. By default, only muxes having > 1 clock/reset inputs are considered

cciOption.name: -dft_clock_ratio
cciOption.help: Minimum frequency ratio of fastest clock to slowest clock arriving at a mux inputs to be considered a DFT logic (default: 2.0)

cciOption.name: -dft_origin_modules
cciOption.help: List of modules name patterns considered as DFT modules (Default JTAG, m1500)

cciCmd.name: configure_delta_delay
cciCmd.info: Configures delta delay check points

cciOption.name: -simulator_file_name
cciOption.help: Specifies the simulator mode file that contains the simulator-specific delta delay information for RTL constructs.

cciOption.name: -start_point
cciOption.help: Name of the clock on which the Delta Delay rules has to be checked. Default: All clocks

cciOption.name: -delta_cycle
cciOption.help: Permissible delta cycle for clock. Default: -1

cciOption.name: -stop_point
cciOption.help: Stop point where clock trace will be stopped.

cciOption.name: -stop_module
cciOption.help: Stop module where clock trace will be stopped.

cciOption.name: -stop_instance
cciOption.help: Stop instance where clock trace will be stopped.

cciOption.name: -ignore_module
cciOption.help: Module should not be considered for delta cycle comparison.

cciOption.name: -ignore_instance
cciOption.help: Instance should not be considered for delta cycle comparison.

cciCmd.name: configure_glitch_free_cells
cciCmd.info: Allows configurability of cells to control pessimism in glitch analysis

cciOption.name: -types
cciOption.value_help: NONE | BBOX | COMPARE | XOR | MUX | SINGLE_INPUT_RECONV
cciOption.help: Specifies the cell type/types

cciOption.name: -path_type
cciOption.help: Specifies the path type of glitch-free cell

cciOption.name: -add
cciOption.help: Add the cell types specified in the -type option to the current existing value

cciOption.name: -ignore_instances
cciOption.help: ignores the cell in the instance specified

cciOption.name: -ignore_modules
cciOption.help: ignores all the cell belonging to the module specified

cciCmd.name: configure_hier_validation
cciCmd.info: Configures validation checks for constraint based abstract model. configure_hier_validation and configure_cdc_validation are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -express
cciOption.help: Enables low noise and low effort validation check for constraint based hier SoC flow

cciOption.name: -reduce_pessimism
cciOption.help: Ignores reporting of validation checks in the specified conditions

cciOption.name: -extended_format
cciOption.value_help: <none | case | combo | data | quasi | clock | reset | virtual | all>
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.value_help: <none | case | combo | data | quasi | clock | reset | virtual | all>
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types

cciOption.name: -traverse_combo
cciOption.help: Enables traversal through combo path or assume path when -analog -testbus switches are specified in apply_attribute

cciOption.name: -group_port_names
cciOption.help: Group related violations together for Clock Domain Mismatch

cciOption.name: -abstract_model
cciOption.help: Type of abstract models for which the command is applicable

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enables Validation of specified list

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disables Validation of specified list

cciOption.name: -translate_clocks
cciOption.help: Translates create_clock/create_generated_clock using refclock

cciOption.name: -report_unconstrained_sam_objects
cciOption.help: Reports the validation mismatch for unconstrained SAM internal objects

cciOption.name: -enable_mismatch_reason_column
cciOption.help: Specifies mismatch reason between abstract block and top-level design. Default: false

cciOption.name: -show_constant_source
cciOption.help: Use this option to specify the constant source type as SCA, RTL, or MIXED

cciOption.name: -sync_analysis
cciOption.help: Use this option to perform sync analysis in Data-Path Domain Validation checks

cciOption.name: -strict_clock_domain_validation
cciOption.help: Enables strict validation of clock domains. When set to true, a top level clock pair is considered synchronous if any one of the pairs of user-level-clocks is synchronous.

cciOption.name: -enable_sam_internalobj_validation
cciOption.help: Specifies to enable the validation checks on internal SAM objects. Under this option, only the Clock and Reset validation mismatch are performed on the internal SAM objects. Default value of this option is 'true'.

cciOption.name: -allow_unclocked_sources
cciOption.help: Specify to treat unclocked object as valid source for combo validation on output ports. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_hanging_sources
cciOption.help: Specify to treat hanging object as valid source for combo validation on output ports. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_quasi_sources
cciOption.help: Specify the option value 'false' to not to treat quasi-static signals as valid sources for combo validation on output ports. Default: true

cciOption.name: -disable_for_combo_yes
cciOption.help: Specify to disable the combo validation checks for output ports constrained with combo attribute value 'yes'. Default: false

cciOption.name: -ignore_top_quasi
cciOption.help: By default, the validation mismatch is ignored when a quasi-signal reaches a block port and quasi_static is specified in the -reduce_pessimism option. Use this option to not honor quasi_static pessimism reduction for specified mismatch types. Default: none.

cciCmd.name: configure_inferred_clock_name
cciCmd.info: configure the name of inferred clocks

cciOption.name: -prefix
cciOption.help: Add prefix in the name of inferred clocks

cciCmd.name: configure_integrity_checks
cciCmd.info: Enables Integrity checks based on user inputs. configure_integrity_checks and configure_cdc_integrity_checks are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -clock_race_thru_latch
cciOption.help: Prohibits propagation through latches. Default: false

cciOption.name: -clockgate_enable_glitch
cciOption.help: Enables SETUP_CLKGATE_GLITCH violation reporting if latch data is undriven or set as constant. Default: true

cciOption.name: -reset_deassert_value_as_sca
cciOption.help: While validating high and low usage of sync reset for INTEGRITY_SYNCRESET_HIGH_AND_LOW_USAGE tag, enable other sync resets acts as set_case_analysis in its de-assert value to block the validating current sync reset. Default: false

cciOption.name: -clockgate_allow_sdc_clock
cciOption.help: Enables INTEGRITY_CLOCKGATE_GLITCH violation reporting if new clock (create_clock/create_generated_clock) is defined at the output of AND/OR gate. Default: none

cciOption.name: -report_all_flops
cciOption.help: Enables to dump csv for other sequentials which are not reported with INTEGRITY_RESET_ASYNC_AND_SYNC_USAGE tag. Dump one csv per reset with reset name. Default: none

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.help: Enables the reporting of drivers information for the specified check. Default: none

cciOption.name: -extended_format
cciOption.help: Enables dumping of violations in detailed format for specified types. Default: none

cciOption.name: -report_detail
cciOption.help: Specifies if all violations should be reported for each clock or only one violation should be reported per clock for Clock_check10/INTEGRITY_CLOCK_AS_NON_CLOCK tags. Default: all

cciOption.name: -report_derived_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies if INTEGRITY_RESET_ASYNC_AND_SYNC_USAGE or SETUP_RESET_DRIVING_NON_ASYNC_PIN tag should report for asynchronous derived resets. Default: none

cciOption.name: -clock_edge
cciOption.help: Reports INTEGRITY_CLOCKEDGE_UNEXPECTED violation for either clock posedge or clock negedge used in design. Default : positive. Set this parameter to negative to report clock descriptions for which a positive edge specified

cciOption.name: -clkedge_unexpected_viol_report_obj
cciOption.help: Use this option to set the type of end object for which INTEGRITY_CLOCKEDGE_UNEXPECTED violation should be reported. Default : flip-flop. Other possible values are black-box,latch,lib-cell and all.

cciOption.name: -report_all_fanouts_convergences
cciOption.help: When set to true, report INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violation for all instances of clock reconvergences. Else report only one instance of reconvergence per clock. Default: false.

cciCmd.name: configure_ip_block
cciCmd.info: User can specify the ip block in their design, which are used to configure the behavior/reporting of CDC, RDC and ResetAsync types of crossings present inside these blocks. By default, RDC crossings, which are present inside user specified blocks are reported as ignored.

cciOption.name: -names
cciOption.help: List of modules or cells, which are IP-blocks in the design. They are used to determine whether crossings (source and destination) are present in the ip-block.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: It defines the type of crossing for which tool behavior reporting needs to be configured. Multiple types can be specified together. It must be specified with -names option. Default: rdc

cciOption.name: -report
cciOption.help: When specified, it will use the specified ip blocks in -names option to generate the ip-block reports in violations for specified checks. New value of this option would override the previous values

cciOption.name: -skip_cdc_analysis
cciOption.help: Specify this option to suppress the generation and reporting of crossings inside IP block, which were specified with '-names' option in same command or other commands. This can be considered like global option, which will apply to all the IP blocks specified (either before or after) in the current run. When this option is false, crossings inside IP block specified with '-names' will be reported as ignored. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_property_panel
cciCmd.info: Configures the data shown in the schematics property panel

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Show (default) or hide the clock/reset name

cciOption.name: -object
cciOption.help: Show (default) or hide the clock/reset object

cciOption.name: -reset_value
cciOption.help: Show (default) or hide the reset value

cciOption.name: -add
cciOption.help: Add a custom attribute

cciOption.name: -remove
cciOption.help: Remove a custom attribute

cciCmd.name: configure_quasi_signal
cciCmd.info: Configure Quasi signals

cciOption.name: -auto_infer
cciOption.help: By default, Quasi-static signals are auto inferred, Set auto_infer to false, When auto infer of Quasi-static signals are not require.

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_abstract_model
cciCmd.info: Configures design abstraction in rdc flow

cciOption.name: -exclude_fully
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of primary input or inout ports to be ignored completely as start points for design abstraction for RDC

cciOption.name: -seq_fanout_threshold
cciOption.help: Threshold value for percentage sequential elements seen in the fanout cone. Beyond this threshold value a warning will be issued for impact on SAM abstraction as high fanout can cause higher percentage of RDC logic being retained. Default : 10

cciOption.name: -report_abstraction
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of preserved sequential elements during SAM abstraction in JSON file. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_convergence
cciCmd.info: Configures several convergence detection criteria

cciOption.name: -num_convergences
cciOption.help: Specifies the number of parallel convergences to be reported for any set of synchronizers. Default : 1

cciOption.name: -stop_at_sources
cciOption.help: Specifies whether to stop at sources of other crossings or not. Default : false

cciOption.name: -ignore_among_signals
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which must be synchronizer output pins, among which convergences should not be reported

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enables RDC convergence. By default, convergence checks are disabled.

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_corrupt
cciCmd.info: Configures the detection of RDC corruption

cciOption.name: -report_resetless_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destination with no reset - Default: true

cciOption.name: -report_rdc_on_cdc
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption between source and destination with different clock domain (CDC) - Default: false

cciOption.name: -enable_pessimism_on_cdc
cciOption.help: Enables pessimism while discarding CDC paths from RDC analysis. If there are common or synchronous clocks between source and destination, then also create RDC even with different clock domain (CDC) when '-report_rdc_on_cdc is set to false' - Default: false

cciOption.name: -skip_resetless_flops
cciOption.help: Skips the RDC corruption through resetless flops - Default: false

cciOption.name: -skip_resetless_memories
cciOption.help: Skips the RDC corruption through resetless memories when running skip resetless flow - Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_unconnected_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destinations being unconnected when running skip resetless flow - Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_memory_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destinations being memories - Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_memory_source
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for sources being memories - Default: true

cciOption.name: -report_bbox_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destinations being a bbox input when running skip resetless flow - Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_cgc_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destinations being an enable pin of Clock Gating Cell- Default: true

cciOption.name: -report_observable_cgc_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the generation of observable RDC corruption at the clock end points for destinations being a clock-gating-cell latch/flop- Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_line_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the RDC corruption for destinations being Clock pin of sequential element- Default: true

cciOption.name: -report_observable_clock_line_destination
cciOption.help: Reports the point where clock line Corruption is observable for corrupt destinations being a clock pin of latch/flop- Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_combo_port_destination
cciOption.help: Reports primary output destinations. In observability or skip resetless flow, this argument is applicable to paths with no intermediate flops. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_unconstrained_port_destination
cciOption.help: Reports primary output destinations. This argument is applicable to Cycle Aware RDC flow only. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_flop_with_undecl_rst
cciOption.help: Reports crossings to the destination flops that have undeclared reset. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_rdc_static_source
cciOption.help: Reports RDC paths which are ignored due to create_rdc_static under info violations. Default: false

cciOption.name: -check_crossing_to
cciOption.help: Reports the inputs of specified cells which observe corruption during observability analysis

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_corruption_with_depth
cciCmd.info: Configures analysis to find paths which exceed given depth for reset assertion

cciOption.name: -reset
cciOption.help: Reset Names for which analysis needs to be done Default: All resets

cciOption.name: -safe_depth
cciOption.help: Maximum number of sequentials which can be assumed safe after reset assertion

cciOption.name: -max_depth_path
cciOption.help: Provide this boolean flag to report max depth path, By Default: tool reports any path greater than safe_depth

cciOption.name: -time_limit
cciOption.help: Maximum time (in minutes) allocated for this check

cciOption.name: -per_reset_time_limit
cciOption.help: Provide this boolean flag to treat the specified time_limit per user reset, By Default tool applies time_limt on overall check

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_cycle_aware
cciCmd.info: Configures the Cycle Aware flow of RDC

cciOption.name: -check_observable_rdc
cciOption.help: Enables the cycle aware flow. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_unobservable_rdc
cciOption.help: Reports the crossing paths that are blocked. Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_ref_clock
cciOption.help: Enables auto-inference of reference clock period in set_event command. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_one_viol_per_metastable_flop
cciOption.help: Reports one endpoint for safe crossing path with multiple endpoints. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_one_cdc_ep_per_metastable_flop
cciOption.help: Reports one endpoint for crossing path with multiple cdc endpoints. Default: false

cciOption.name: -inactive_resets_val_unknown
cciOption.help: Enables simulation of resets missing from scenario with value 'X' instead of inactive value. Default: false

cciOption.name: -threshold_depth
cciOption.help: Specifies the maximum sequential depth of blocking analysis. Default: 10

cciOption.name: -check_resettable_seq_fanout
cciOption.help: Enables analysis in fanout of resettable sequential destinations and endpoints. Default: true

cciOption.name: -stop_at_clock
cciOption.help: Stop Rdc analysis at the clock pin of a sequential. Default: false

cciOption.name: -stop_at_asyncrst_pin
cciOption.help: Stop Rdc analysis at the asynchronous reset pin of a sequential. Default: true

cciOption.name: -stop_at_revisit
cciOption.help: Stop Rdc endpoint analysis on the already visited sequential element. Default: false

cciOption.name: -stop_cgc_ep
cciOption.help: Stop Rdc endpoint analysis at the clock pin of a sequential for the cgc path. Default: false

cciOption.name: -run_sam_scenarios
cciOption.help: Migrate SAM block scenario dynamically in Top run and analyze. Default: false

cciOption.name: -data_crossing_observed_ep_limit
cciOption.help: Limit number of observable endpoints per data path crossing. Blocked endpoint due to different clock domain(BLOCKED_DUE_TO_CDC) is configurable using this option. Default: 64

cciOption.name: -sam_scenario_delimiter
cciOption.help: Delimiter to be added in Scenario name when adding Hierarchy and SAM Identifier. Default '_'

cciOption.name: -waveform_precision
cciOption.help: Set waveform precision decimal places. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -cgc_crossing_observed_ep_limit
cciOption.help: Limit number of observable clock-pins endpoints per RDC destination. Default: 1

cciOption.name: -multi_scenario
cciOption.help: Enables dynamic multi scenario creation and running every scenario as children. Default: false

cciOption.name: -stop_at_reset
cciOption.help: It defines conditions to be checked to stop at a resettable sequential. Default : {async_undecl sync_undecl }

cciOption.name: -event_overlap
cciOption.help: Allows overlapping events specified using set_event in create_reset_scenario. Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_b2b_signal_overlap
cciOption.help: Allows overlapping set_event -signal if signal deassert and assert overlap at same time, deassertion will be ignored. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_blocked_src
cciOption.help: Controls whether to report safe RDC due to Source blocking on gate before destination. Default: all

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_formal
cciCmd.info: Performs formal RDC checks

cciOption.name: -maxdepth
cciOption.help: Sequential depth to analyze. Default : 0

cciOption.name: -maxmem
cciOption.help: Memory threshold per property (in MB) before giving up

cciOption.name: -engine
cciOption.help: Select proof engine. Default : acr

cciOption.name: -stable_controls
cciOption.help: Assumes non-clock/reset inputs to be stable

cciOption.name: -check_reset_gated
cciOption.help: Analyze whether crossings are blocked by the destination reset

cciOption.name: -check_clock_gated
cciOption.help: Analyze whether crossings are blocked by the destination clock

cciOption.name: -check_enable_gated
cciOption.help: Analyze whether crossings are blocked by the destination enable

cciOption.name: -check_any_gated
cciOption.help: Analyze whether crossings are blocked by any of destination reset/clock/enable

cciOption.name: -check_potential_rdc
cciOption.help: To run formal on RDC_CORRUPT_POTENTIAL too

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_glitch
cciCmd.info: Configures glitch checking criteria

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enables RDC glitch. By default, glitch checks are disabled.

cciOption.name: -glitch_unate_analysis
cciOption.help: Specifies if glitch violation for source convergence with same polarity are reported. Default: false

cciOption.name: -dest
cciOption.help: Enables glitch analysis for this particular destination node. Please provide the destination name as reported in RDC_CORRUPT* / RDC_CLOCK_CORRUPT* violation

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_nff_sync
cciCmd.info: It configures the multi-flop synchronizer detection by the tool

cciOption.name: -from_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the source of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: List of clocks on the destination of the control crossings

cciOption.name: -skip_sync
cciOption.help: It disables the auto detection of multi-flop synchronizers

cciOption.name: -depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential depth to be considered as valid multi-flop synchronizer. The depth will be considered value specified and above (depth 1 indicates sequential depth of 1 or more to be considered as valid multiflop synchronizer). Default value: 2

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: It enables the auto detection of multi-flop synchronizers globally

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_qualifier
cciCmd.info: Configures global options for RDC blocking schemes

cciOption.name: -depth
cciOption.help: Sequential depth between qualifier signal and the blocking gate on data crossing, Default : 0

cciOption.name: -allow_block_type
cciOption.help: Defines legal blocking scheme types for blocking condition detection, Default: {and, clock_gate, mux_recirc, mux_select, or}

cciOption.name: -allow_block_cell
cciOption.help: Specifies modules or cells that are valid for blocking condition

cciOption.name: -allow_and_or_based_cgc
cciOption.help: It allows AND/OR/NAND/NOR gates to be treated as valid Clock Gating cells for CGC based blocking scheme, Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_merged_qualifier
cciOption.help: Allows gate at which source and the qualifier merges to act as a new qualifier for other sources, Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_qual_clk_domain
cciOption.help: Controls the behaviour to assume an unclocked qualifier signal to be in clock domain of fanout sequential, provided only one clock domain is found in the fanout, Default: true

cciOption.name: -allow_async_rst_as_qual
cciOption.help: Treats asynchronous resets as inferred qualifiers, Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_rdc_static_as_qual
cciOption.help: Treats sequentials with create_rdc_static constraint as qualifiers, Default: true

cciOption.name: -allow_iso_enable_as_qual
cciOption.help: Treats isolation enable signal extracted from UPF file as inferred qualifiers, Default: false

cciOption.name: -allow_resetless_dest_on_qual
cciOption.help: Controls qualifier propagation through Resetless sequentials when they are destination, Default: true

cciOption.name: -allow_reset_order_on_qual
cciOption.help: Controls qualifier propagation through Reset Sequence, Default: true

cciOption.name: -simulate_qual_expr
cciOption.help: Controls the simulation of expr in set_rdc_qualifier, if set to false, signals in -expr are treated as -object, Default: true

cciOption.name: -ignore_qual_clk_domain
cciOption.help: Controls the clock domain based checks done in qualifier propagation and acceptance, Default: false

cciOption.name: -check_sync_cell_on_rdc
cciOption.help: Reports a skip_resetless flow RDC as RDC_CORRUPT_BLOCKED if there's an intermediate sync_cell between source and destination, Default: true

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disables the qualifier based blocking analysis

cciCmd.name: configure_rdc_violation
cciCmd.info: Enables configurations on violations, such as setting limit of violation generation count per group of tags/rules

cciOption.name: -limit
cciOption.help: Limits count of violations to be generated per group of tags or rules. Default : 1000000

cciCmd.name: configure_set_clock_group
cciCmd.info: configure the domain inference of clocks

cciOption.name: -consider_async_relation
cciOption.help: consider the async relation for clocks which are not specified in any set clock group command

cciOption.name: -logically_exclusive_as_async
cciOption.help: Assume logically_exclusive clocks specified in set_clock_group command as async clocks

cciOption.name: -override_physically_exclusive_clock_relationship
cciOption.help: Overrides existing clock relationship with physically exclusive relationship for those clocks which are defined on exactly same design objects

cciOption.name: -consider_sfp_clocks_async
cciOption.help: Considers two clocks as asynchronous if there exists a two-way relationship of set_false_path command between these clocks

cciOption.name: -consider_set_max_clocks_async
cciOption.help: Considers two clocks as asynchronous if there exists a two-way relationship of set_max_delay command between these clocks

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: When set to true,then clock relationship will infer using set_clock_group. When set to false, then clock relationship will infer using domain field of create_clock command. Default true.

cciCmd.name: configure_setup_blackbox
cciCmd.info: Configure parameters for blackbox modeling and setup. configure_setup_blackbox and configure_cdc_setup_blackbox are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -ignore_module_type
cciOption.help: Specifies to criteria to ignore modeling and CDC analysis for blackboxes

cciOption.name: -ignore_module_names
cciOption.help: Specifies list of module names for which Setup_blackbox01 does not need to be reported

cciOption.name: -report_abstract_module_coverage
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report coverage of abstracted module under setup_blackbox01. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_setup_check
cciCmd.info: Configures parameters values for setup related checks.configure_setup_check and configure_cdc_setup_check are aliases of each other.

cciOption.name: -report_latch
cciOption.help: Report violations on latches

cciOption.name: -report_reset_undecl_on_const_clock
cciOption.help: Report unreset sequentials whose clock pin is receiving a constant value

cciOption.name: -filter_reset_undecl_on_quasi_static
cciOption.help: Enables the SETUP_RESET_UNDECL to not report violations when the nes are constrained as quasi static

cciOption.name: -report_clock_glitch_on_hanging_net
cciOption.help: Report SETUP_CLOCK_GLITCH with hanging net destination

cciOption.name: -report_quasi_static_clock_as_constant
cciOption.help: Report quasi-static clock pins as constant instead of undeclared

cciOption.name: -report_only_sca_violations
cciOption.help: Report SETUP_*_CONSTANT only if they are caused by a set_case_analysis

cciOption.name: -clock_on_ports
cciOption.help: Report clock overlaps/convergence on output ports

cciOption.name: -reset_on_ports
cciOption.help: Report reset overlaps/convergence on output ports

cciOption.name: -same_domain_overlap
cciOption.help: Report overlaps of same-domain clocks in SGUM

cciOption.name: -clock_undecl_rca
cciOption.help: Analyze the reason for unclocked pins

cciOption.name: -check_port_setup
cciOption.help: Ports on which to checks SETUP_PORT

cciOption.name: -report_propagated_coverage
cciOption.help: Reports ports and blockbox pins as constrained due to propagation of clock, reset. quasi static and constant signals. Default: true

cciOption.name: -no_unate_reconv
cciOption.help: Report clock/reset convergence only if both positive & negative polarities converge

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_sequential
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP and SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP violations only if clock is reaching any sequential element

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_data_path
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED and INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violations on data path

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_constrained_mux
cciOption.help: Report or Supress the reporting of SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED and SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP_CONSTRAINED When mux select is constant. Default is true.

cciOption.name: -report_clock_reconvergence_on_mux
cciOption.help: Reports INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE violations on Muxs

cciOption.name: -check_reset_for_constclock
cciOption.help: Reports the status of set and preset pins of those sequentials whose clock pin is tied to constant value

cciOption.name: -report_all_seq_for_assert_missing
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_RESET_ASSERT_MISSING violation for all sequentials

cciOption.name: -annotate_reset_assertion
cciOption.help: Annotates the reset value for SETUP_RESET_ASSERT_MISSING violations

cciOption.name: -report_all_asyncreset_combo
cciOption.help: Report multiple violations for the same input cone driven by combinational logic when the same input cone is driving multiple flops

cciOption.name: -report_reset_path_mux
cciOption.help: Report a violation when the asynchronous set/reset pins of a sequential element are driven by mux

cciOption.name: -clock_usage
cciOption.help: Specify signal types to be reported for non-clock usage

cciOption.name: -async_reset_usage
cciOption.help: Specify signal types to be reported for non-reset usage

cciOption.name: -all_converging_clocks
cciOption.help: Reports all the clocks converging on a mux

cciOption.name: -ignore_ports_for_inferdom
cciOption.help: Ignores domain specified on output port during auto-inference of domain for input ports and vica versa

cciOption.name: -report_clkglitch_on_io
cciOption.help: Reports SETUP_CLOCK_GLITCH violations on those inout ports where user clock is defined

cciOption.name: -report_glitch_on_bbox
cciOption.help: Report clock glitch driving only black box

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_on_genclk
cciOption.help: Report clock overwrite if geneated clock is driven by any other clock

cciOption.name: -report_overlap_to_genclk
cciOption.help: Report clock overlaps if overlapping points drives geneated clock

cciOption.name: -dump_detailed_info
cciOption.value_help: <none | clockUndecl | libCellComboDrivenAsyncPin | resetConstActive | resetConstInactive | resetAssertMissing | inputMultiClkLoad | outputMultiClkDriver | inputMultiClkLoadInferredDomain | outputMultiClkDriverInferredDomain | all>
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of drivers information for the specified check. Default: none

cciOption.name: -latch_as_seq
cciOption.help: Specify as true to consider latch output as generated_clock for Clock_info01 rule in Spyglass like flow. Default: false

cciOption.name: -show_constant_source
cciOption.help: Show the type of constant source is driving the constant value for clock and data constant tag/rules. Default: false

cciOption.name: -max_reset_const_active_seq_count
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum number of SETUP_RESET_CONSTANT_ACTIVE violations for each constant reset source. Default: 3

cciOption.name: -report_port_as_partial
cciOption.help: Controls the reporting of a port as partially constrained. Default: all

cciOption.name: -soft_reset_through_mux_select_non_const
cciOption.help: Allows to control soft resets identification in the fanin of mux select line when at least one mux input is non-constant signal. Default: always

cciOption.name: -report_soft_reset_on_ports
cciOption.help: Allows to report primary ports (input/inout) which are not constrained as resets, as soft resets if they are merging to a reset path through a combinational logic. Default: false

cciOption.name: -reset_undecl_fanin_reset_check
cciOption.help: Reports user resets that are in the fanin of unconstrained RST/SET pin with SETUP_RESET_UNDECL tag. Default: false

cciOption.name: -reset_undecl_fanin_seq_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while searching fanin resets for SETUP_RESET_UNDECL tag. This impacts only when -reset_undecl_fanin_reset_check option is true. Values between 0 and 100 are allowed. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -soft_reset_analysis_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while doing soft reset analysis. Terminology for calculating required depth; latch represents depth 0.5, flop represents depth 1, complex libcell represents depth 2. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -generated_reset_master_search_depth
cciOption.help: Allows to set maximum sequential count to cross while searching master reset in create_generated_reset command. -1 for infinite. Default: 4

cciOption.name: -reset_sim_active_value
cciOption.help: Allows to perform simulation by applying active value on all reset and use the simulated value as active value for reset constraints generated on output ports during abstraction. Default: false

cciOption.name: -report_driving_reset_pin_count
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to report the number of reset pin count that each reset is driving with SETUP_RESET_PROPAGATED tag. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_port_as_constrained
cciOption.help: Specify this option to report clock ports/pins as fully constrianed when clock is reaching to them. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_multiclkload_for_inferred_singledom
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to false then the violation for the tag SETUP_INPUT_CONSTRAINED_MULTICLK_LOAD would not be reported for ports on which only single domain is inferred by the tool. Default : true

cciOption.name: -report_clock_undecl_on_blocked_pin
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to true then the violation for the tag SETUP_CLOCK_UNDECL would be reported when clock is blocked on the complex sequential library cell clock pin. Default : false

cciOption.name: -disable_crm_load
cciOption.help: Disables clock relationship matrix loading. Default: false

cciOption.name: -infer_from_abstract_block
cciOption.help: Enables the inference of potential clock/reset sources starting from abstract block input clock/reset pins. This would impact VC SG rules Clock_info01/Reset_info01. In VC, this would impacet tag SETUP_RESET_INFER. Default: none

cciOption.name: -check_constraints_on_pin
cciOption.help: When set to yes , then Tag Setup_port01/Setup_black01 would check on Port/Pin and not get constraint from connected net.

cciOption.name: -report_user_defined_fanin_nets
cciOption.help: When this option is set to true, user defined fan in nets are reported for tags INTEGRITY_CLOCK_RECONVERGE, SETUP_SYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP, SETUP_ASYNC_CLOCK_OVERLAP. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_multiclkdriver_for_inferred_singledom
cciOption.help: When this option would be set to false then the violation for the tag SETUP_OUTPUT_CONSTRAINED_MULTICLK_DRIVER would not be reported for ports on which only single domain is inferred by the tool. Default : true

cciOption.name: -report_single_overwrite_violation_per_clock_root
cciOption.help: Report only one violation if there are multiple clocks defined on the same clock root and which are overlap. Default : false

cciOption.name: -param_mismatch
cciOption.help: Checks parameters mismatch between module and its corresponding current_design.

cciOption.name: -non_default_abstract
cciOption.help: Generate and consume abstract model in non-default style, without def_param.

cciOption.name: -check_clock_path_module_glitch
cciOption.help: Specify list of module in clock path on which you want to perform glitch analysis

cciOption.name: -report_all_setup_data_constant_violation
cciOption.help: Set this to true to report all SETUP_DATA_CONSTANT violation without checking set and reset status, By Default these two cases are not reported. 1. data pin constant value 1 with reset 2.data pin constant value 0 with set. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_moduleglitch_all_inst
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to all report issue for all instances of a user specify having glitch issue for tag SETUP_CLOCK_MODULEGLITCH. Default : false

cciOption.name: -report_clock_moduleglitch_all_pins
cciOption.help: Set this option to true to all report issue for all pins per instance of a user specify having glitch issue for tag SETUP_CLOCK_MODULEGLITCH. Default : false

cciOption.name: -enable_partial_constraint_for_bbox_libcells
cciOption.help: Set this option to enable partial constraint feature for bbox and libcells, By Default bbox and libcell only support unconstraint or fully constraint. Default : false

cciCmd.name: configure_setup_libcell
cciCmd.info: Configures parameters for libcell setup and modeling. configure_setup_libcell and configure_cdc_setup_libcell are aliases of each other

cciOption.name: -user_analysis_module
cciOption.help: Specifies the list of those library cells which are required to be analyzed

cciOption.name: -unconstr_libcell_pin_synchronized
cciOption.help: Libcell input and inout pins which are not associated with any real clock would be assumed synchronized inside the libcell

cciOption.name: -auto_infer_internal_pins
cciOption.help: By Default, Internal Pins are not modelled for Libcell. Set this option to true to enable Libcell Modeling for Interal Pins. default false.

cciOption.name: -dump_constraint
cciOption.value_help: <default | timing_arc_missing | timing_arc_specified | pin_unconnected | pin_constant | pin_quasi | all>
cciOption.help: Generate constraints for lib-cell pins. Default: 'timing_arc_missing timing_arc_specified'

cciCmd.name: configure_setup_port
cciCmd.info: Configures SETUP_PORT_* tags

cciOption.name: -report_unconstrained
cciOption.help: Specifies strict checking conditions for ignored ports

cciOption.name: -infer_datapath_dom_for_clockpath
cciOption.help: When this option is set to true and port is driving clock pin of sequential (which is driven by user clocks), then user clocks of sequential will be inferred as data path domain on this port. Default value is false.

cciCmd.name: configure_synthesis_block
cciCmd.info: Specifies the list of blocks which will enable tool to generate crossing information in context with the user provided synthesis blocks.

cciOption.name: -block
cciOption.help: List of blocks

cciCmd.name: configure_unconstrained_ports
cciCmd.info: Configures to model unconstrainted inputs and outputs of top, black-box modules, and lib modules

cciOption.name: -module
cciOption.help: Name of the top module, any black-box module, or any libcell module in the design

cciOption.name: -input_model
cciOption.value_help: <auto | virtual_diff_vector | virtual_diff_bits | virtual_diff_cell | virtual_diff_dir | virtual_same | virtual_sync_all | no_cross>
cciOption.help: Specifies to infer the domain information for the input ports of the top module, black-box module(s), or lib module(s) specified in the 'module' argument. For all, Default :auto.

cciOption.name: -output_model
cciOption.value_help: <auto | virtual_diff_vector | virtual_diff_bits | virtual_diff_cell | virtual_diff_dir | virtual_same | virtual_sync_all | no_cross>
cciOption.help: Specifies to infer the domain information for the output ports of the top module, black-box module(s), or lib module(s) specified in the 'module' argument. Output_model value as 'auto' is not allowed to infer top ports. For bbox and libs, Default :auto. For Ports, Default :no_cross.

cciOption.name: -auto_config
cciOption.help: Specifies the configuration for auto type modelling. Default :disable_virtual_diff

cciOption.name: -use_inferred_domains
cciOption.help: This option is used to specify whether the inferred domain should be used for verification

cciOption.name: -all_bbox
cciOption.help: Specifies to infer the domain information for all black boxes in the design

cciOption.name: -all_libs
cciOption.help: Specifies to infer the domain information for all libcells in the design. This option is supported with -input_model and -output_model only.

cciOption.name: -reset
cciOption.help: Specifies to infer the reset domain information for specified cells or all cells in the design. This option is supported for library cell modules only.

cciOption.name: -dir
cciOption.help: Specifies the directory where the port/bbox/lib templates are generated. By default, the templates get generated in 'vcst_rtdb/cdc_aep' directory.

cciOption.name: -input_sync
cciOption.help: when set to cdc, unconstrained pins of Lib Cell and Black-boxes which are got associated with virtual will also be considered as cdc synchronizers, this is only applicable for input pins. Default: none

cciCmd.name: configure_userpath_glitch
cciCmd.info: Configures user-path glitch checks

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specify list of clocks or sequential cells or sequential pins/ports

cciOption.name: -to
cciOption.help: Specify list of clocks or sequential cells or sequential pins/ports

cciOption.name: -user_path_commands
cciOption.value_help: <mcp | mcp_sync | mcp_async | fp | fp_sync | fp_async | glitch_path | glitch_path_sync | glitch_path_async | p2p | p2p_sync | p2p_async | all>
cciOption.help: Enables glitch analysis on synchronous/asynchronous paths corresponding to set_multicycle_path/set_false_path/set_point2point_glitch constraints. The options, glitch_path, glitch_path_sync and glitch_path_async, are deprecated. The options, p2p, p2p_sync and p2p_async, respectively, are recommended to use instead. Default: all

cciOption.name: -mcp_type
cciOption.help: Enables processing of set_multicycle_path constraints of type setup/hold/both Default: setup

cciOption.name: -user_path_multiple_source
cciOption.help: Specify the types of sources that needs to be considered for multi-source convergence analysis in user specified paths. This option is applicable only when 'user_path_all' or 'user_path_obj' is specified in glitch_type option. Default: Always report glitch between multiple user-specified sources only

cciOption.name: -enable_point
cciOption.value_help: <and | or | mux | enable_point_cell | library_cell | all | none>
cciOption.help: It defines legal computation points for exception path enable detection. Default : {all}

cciOption.name: -enable_point_cell
cciOption.help: Specifies modules or cells that are valid for enable detection in glitch paths

cciOption.name: -allow_merged_expression
cciOption.help: Considers the enable signal as valid even if it merges with source of user specified path

cciOption.name: -enable_expr
cciOption.help: Specifies the enable signal expression which blocks the glitch on the paths corresponding to the objects specified in -from/-to

cciOption.name: -auto_enable_type
cciOption.help: Specifies the type of enable to be auto-generated. Default : {rtl_expr}

cciOption.name: -allow_source_blocking
cciOption.help: Enables verification based on source blocking. Default : true

cciOption.name: -report_auto_enables
cciOption.help: Specifies number of blocking enables to be reported for each blocked source

cciOption.name: -ignore_enable_expr
cciOption.help: Specifies the enable signal expression which should be ignored for glitch blocking analysis

cciOption.name: -report_sync_info
cciOption.help: Specify the option to report the userpaths as synchronized due to multi-flop structure or due to sync-cell Default : false

cciOption.name: -unrelated
cciOption.help: Specify design objects which act as unrelated signals in the design

cciOption.name: -ignore_among_signals
cciOption.help: Specify design objects which can be source output pins, among which glitch due to multi-source convergence should not be reported

cciOption.name: -multi_src_check_type
cciOption.help: Specify the types of sources that needs to be considered for glitch detection in case ,of multiple sources. Default : all

cciOption.name: -reconv_check_type
cciOption.help: Specify the types of sources that needs to be considered for glitch detection in case of reconverging sources. Default : all

cciOption.name: -glitch_type
cciOption.help: Specify the glitch path types that needs to be considered for glitch detection. Default : user_path_all

cciOption.name: -glitch_unate_analysis
cciOption.help: Specify whether to report glitch violation for same source re-convergence with same polarity. Default: false

cciOption.name: -glitch_on_unconstrained_src
cciOption.help: Enables checking for glitch on unconstrained ports and unconstrained bbox-pins present in the input cone of a destination

cciOption.name: -allow_enable_analysis
cciOption.help: Perform the enable analysis for specified userpath command(s). Default: {mcp p2p}

cciOption.name: -allow_combo_in_p2p
cciOption.help: When value true is specified, then -fromand -to fields of set_point2point_glitch command allow specification of unclocked design objects. These unclocked design objects can be pins of combinational elements, hierarchical port, unconstrained top-level ports, unconstrained blackbox pins. Default: false

cciCmd.name: configure_userpath_glitch_formal
cciCmd.info: Configures formal checks for user-path glitches

cciOption.name: -multi_src
cciOption.help: Specify the types of user-path glitch sources that needs to be considered for formal verification in case of multiple sources. Mix type of sources in a single violation will not be considered. Default : all

cciOption.name: -reconv_src
cciOption.help: Specify whether to perform formal verification on single reconverging user-path sources. Default : true

cciCmd.name: create_cdc_abstract_model
cciCmd.info: Invoke abstraction for clock domain crossing violations

cciOption.name: -stage
cciOption.help: Specifies CDC stages for abstraction

cciOption.name: -gen_report
cciOption.help: Generates a text report for the abstract model

cciOption.name: -j
cciOption.help: Number of threads to be used in parallel mode

cciOption.name: -reference
cciOption.help: Generate Reference SAM model for parameterized modeule

cciOption.name: -full_logic
cciOption.help: Generate SAM model by retaining 100% block logic

cciCmd.name: create_rdc_abstract_model
cciCmd.info: Invoke abstraction for reset domain crossing violations

cciOption.name: -full_logic
cciOption.help: Generate SAM model by retaining 100% block logic

cciCmd.name: create_rdc_static
cciCmd.info: Specify RDC Source that will be ignored for particular reset for RDC analysis purpose

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of port, pins from which RDC paths need to be ignored for particular reset defined in -from_reset

cciOption.name: -from_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of reset objects from which RDC paths need to be ignored for the object defined in -from

cciCmd.name: customize_cdc_abstract_model
cciCmd.info: Customizes design abstraction in cdc flow

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of pins, ports, nets to be considered as start points of the custom retained paths in CDC abstract model

cciOption.name: -to
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of pins, ports, nets to be considered as end points of the custom retained paths in CDC abstract model

cciOption.name: -seq_depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential maximum depth of custom path

cciCmd.name: customize_rdc_abstract_model
cciCmd.info: Customizes design abstraction in rdc flow

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of pins, ports, nets to be considered as start points of the custom retained paths in RDC abstract model

cciOption.name: -to
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of pins, ports, nets to be considered as end points of the custom retained paths in RDC abstract model

cciOption.name: -seq_depth
cciOption.help: Specifies sequential maximum depth of custom path

cciCmd.name: debug_derived_data
cciCmd.info: debug derived data

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Debug Clock or Reset drived data

cciOption.name: -file
cciOption.help: File to write the debug data

cciOption.name: -of_objects
cciOption.help: It is clock pin or reset pin. It is out of sequential for which you want to know the clock pin or reset pin, which led to clock or reset propagating beyond it.

cciCmd.name: define_attribute
cciCmd.info: Defines an attribute with given name in the current scope.

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Name of the attribute

cciOption.name: -objects
cciOption.help: Design port or pins attributes to be attached to

cciOption.name: -add
cciOption.help: Specify if this command is not to be treated as overwrite

cciOption.name: -direction
cciOption.help: Direction of inout port/pin only to which this attribute is applicable

cciCmd.name: define_fv_assume_property
cciCmd.info: Generates fvassume for CDC VCF Flow

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify the assume property name

cciOption.name: -clock
cciOption.help: Specify the clock for assume property

cciOption.name: -reset
cciOption.help: Specify the reset for assume property

cciOption.name: -test_expr
cciOption.help: Specify list of test expressions for assume property

cciCmd.name: define_reset_event
cciCmd.info: Specify reset assert/ de-assert with a time stamp

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify the reset event label

cciOption.name: -init
cciOption.help: Specify the start event for the scenario

cciOption.name: -ref
cciOption.help: Specify the start event for the scenario

cciOption.name: -delay
cciOption.help: Specify the delay w.r.t the reference event when this event occurs

cciOption.name: -assert
cciOption.help: List of resets asserted at this reset event

cciOption.name: -deassert
cciOption.help: List of resets de-asserted at this reset event

cciCmd.name: define_reset_scenario
cciCmd.info: Start of the scope within which the reset events will be defined

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify name of the reset-scenario

cciOption.name: -por_resets
cciOption.help: List of power-on-resets associated with this reset-scenario, It will be made obsolete

cciOption.name: -functional_resets
cciOption.help: List of functional-resets associated with this reset-scenario, It will be made obsolete

cciOption.name: -disabled_resets
cciOption.help: List of resets which will be considered OFF in this scenario, sequential driven by these will be considered resetless in current scenario analysis

cciOption.name: -inactive_clocks
cciOption.help: List of clocks that are inactive during this reset-scenario

cciCmd.name: end_constraints_scope
cciCmd.info: Resets the current scope to the previouse scope.

cciCmd.name: end_reset_scenario
cciCmd.info: End of the scope within which the reset events will be defined

cciCmd.name: end_reset_scenario_scope
cciCmd.info: End of the scope within which the reset events will be defined

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify name of the reset-scenario

cciCmd.name: generate_clock_reset_tree
cciCmd.info: Generates the clock matrix data

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Generate Clock(default) or Reset tree

cciCmd.name: generate_datasheet
cciCmd.info: Enables datasheet file generation based on the provided type value.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Enables particular type of datasheet file generation.

cciCmd.name: generate_reset_clock_pair
cciCmd.info: Generates list of unique pairs of reset sources and clock sources from all sequential operators and libcells present in the design

cciOption.name: -file
cciOption.help: Specifies name of output file. By default, if this option is not specified a file named reset_clock_pair.csv will be created as output file.

cciOption.name: -report_sync_reset
cciOption.help: Enables reporting of extra information about reset i.e. whether reset is syncronized reset or not.

cciOption.name: -stop_at_combo
cciOption.help: Enables traversal from the reset to stop at first combo ignoring buffer and inverter.

cciCmd.name: generate_vc_cdc_report_for_sg_comparison
cciCmd.info: Generates detailed reports 'VC-CDC-detailed-report.csv', 'VC-Conv-detailed-report.csv' and 'VC-Glitch-detailed-report.csv'

cciOption.name: -dir
