cciOption.help: Directory where VC-CDC-detailed-report.csv/VC-Conv-detailed-report.csv/VC-Glitch-detailed-report.csv should be generated. By default, the reports get generated in 'vcst_rtdb/CdcVcReports' directory.

cciCmd.name: get_asyncrst_paths

cciOption.name: -to

cciOption.name: -to_domain

cciOption.name: -from_clock

cciOption.name: -to_clock

cciOption.name: -qualifier_depth

cciOption.name: -cause_id

cciOption.name: -to_clock

cciOption.name: -diverging_net_depth

cciOption.name: -of_object

cciCmd.info: Returns the elements for a specific CDC control synchronizer

cciOption.help: To focus on only messages at certain design stages, use this switch with a list of stages. The valid stages are SETUP, GLITCH

cciOption.name: -severity
cciOption.help: To focus on only messages with a certain severity, use this switch with a list of severities. The valid severities are: all, error, info, warning.

cciOption.name: -filter
cciOption.help: This switch allows you to specify complex criteria based on pattern matching. Only violations matching the filter expression will be shown. An expression may contain several terms separated with a double ampersand. Each term has a field name, a comparison operator, and a target string. The field name may be any field name shown in the verbose report; for a field inside a record, use a colon to separate the record path components. The comparison operator is any of the standard operators such as == , !=, =~. See the examples section for several examples.

cciOption.name: -regexp
cciOption.help: Indicates filter expression type to be regular expression (default glob-style)

cciCmd.name: report_rdc_abstraction_info
cciCmd.info: This command writes information about preserved sequential elements during SAM abstraction in the json format to a given file. JSON files created from different versions of the tool can be compared to find out if there's difference between generated abstract models. The differences can be used to find out additionally preserved logic or logic missing in preservation. This command should be used only after configuring configure_rdc_abstract_model using -report_abstraction option, create_rdc_abstract_model and write_abstract_model all in order.

cciOption.name: -file
cciOption.help: Specifies name of output file. By default, if this option is not specified a file named abstraction_report.json will be created as output file.

cciOption.help: Only one violation is reported per disallowed module even if there are multiple operators/libcells present inside the module. Violation will be reported on the first operator of the disallowed module. If no operator is found in the disallowed module then the violation will be reported on the first libcell in the disallowed module. By default, module_level_reporting is disabled.

cciCmd.name: set_event
cciCmd.info: Specify events in reset scenario

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify the event label

cciOption.name: -time_units
cciOption.help: Specify the time unit used by -assert_start, its offset and -assert_duration. 'configure_rdc_cycle_aware -infer_ref_clock' decides the default behavior to be either 'infer_clock' or 'absolute'. With infer_clock, clock period of clock driving the sequential in fanin of reset/signal will be inferred. (NYI:Incase of more than one clock, the fastest will be considered.) With absolute, the assert_start and duration will be considered as it is without any scaling w.r.t clock period. With a clock-name, its period will be used. Any <clock_name> can also be specified to be used instead of inferring clock automatically. With event_label, time_units of specified event will be used

cciOption.name: -assert_start
cciOption.help: Specify the offset for assertion with respect to T=0 or event_label's -assert_start or @deassertion

cciOption.name: -assert_end
cciOption.help: Specify the offset for de-assertion with respect to T=0 or event_label's -assert_start or @deassertion

cciOption.name: -assert_duration
cciOption.help: Specify the assertion duration. The duration will be 'number' of time_units specified in -time_units. If -assert_end is not found for current reset and -assert_duration is unspecified, duration will be considered infinite i.e. reset/signal will never be deaserted

cciOption.name: -ref
cciOption.help: Specify the reference clock or reference event name: Soon to be DEPRECATED, use -time_units

cciOption.name: -assert_ref_delay
cciOption.help: Specify the assert dealy with respect to ref: Soon to be DEPRECATED, use -assert_start

cciOption.name: -assert_event
cciOption.help: Specify the assert period this event: Soon to be DEPRECATED, use -assert_duration

cciOption.name: -resets
cciOption.help: List of resets asserted at this event

cciOption.name: -signals
cciOption.help: List of signals asserted at this event

cciOption.name: -infer_ref_clock
cciOption.help: Overrides the option value given using 'configure_rdc_cycle_aware -infer_ref_clock': Soon to be DEPRECATED, use -time_units

cciOption.name: -active_value

cciOption.name: -gray_signals
cciOption.help: Specifies design objects which act as gray signals in the design

cciCmd.name: set_ignore_attribute
cciCmd.info: When this attribute is applied on a port, it needs to be ignored for validation

cciCmd.name: set_point2point_glitch
cciCmd.info: Specifies the custom paths on which glitch analysis needs to be performed

cciOption.name: -from
cciOption.help: Specify the list of startpoint objects of potential glitch paths. A valid startpoint is a clock, a primary input or inout port that has input delay specified, a sequential cell, a clock pin or output pin of a sequential cell, a data pin of a level-sensitive latch, or a pin that has input delay specified. If a clock is specified, all registers and primary inputs related to that clock are used as path startpoints. If command 'configure_userpath_glitch -allow_combo_in_p2p true' is present before the set_point2point_glitch command, then unclocked design objects like pins of combinational elements, hierarchical port, unconstrained top-level ports, unconstrained blackbox pins are also considered valid start points.

cciOption.name: -through
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of pins, ports, cells or nets through which the potential glitch paths must pass. If you do not specify through option, all potential glitch paths specified using the -from and -to options are affected. You can use multiple -through options in a single command to specify paths that traverse through multiple points in the design. The tool respects the order in which you specify these options.

cciOption.name: -to
cciOption.help: Specify the list of endpoint objects of the potential glitch paths. A valid endpoint is a clock, a primary output or inout port that has output delay specified, a sequential cell, a data pin of a sequential cell, or a pin that has output delay specified. If a clock is specified, all registers and primary outputs related to that clock are used as path endpoints. If command 'configure_userpath_glitch -allow_combo_in_p2p true' is present before the set_point2point_glitch command, then unclocked designobjects like pins of combinational elements, hierarchical port, unconstrained top-level ports, unconstrained blackbox pins are also considered valid end points.

cciCmd.name: set_rdc_define_assertion_sequence
cciCmd.info: Specify reset assertion sequence

cciOption.name: -from_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of Reset objects which assert after the -to_reset list. Note that object names cannot be used if there is a logical name for the reset.

cciOption.name: -to_reset
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of Reset objects which assert before the -from_reset list. Note that object names cannot be used if there is a logical name for the reset.

cciOption.name: -to_clock
cciOption.help: Specifies a list of Clock objects which are inactive before -from_reset list asserts and remains inactive during -from_reset list assertion. Both object name and logical name can be used for clocks.

cciOption.name: -rising_edge
cciOption.help: Specify that rising edge for destination clocks are allowed only when the source reset is driven by same clock with falling edge

cciOption.name: -falling_edge
cciOption.help: Specify that falling edge for destination clocks are allowed only when the source reset is driven by same clock with rising edge

cciOption.name: -to_resetless
cciOption.help: Specifies that for RDC paths with resetless destination, consider -from_reset to be non-asserting

cciCmd.name: set_compile_abstractions
cciCmd.info: Enable abstraction inferencing during compilation.

cciOption.name: -construct
cciOption.help: list of design constructs and size thresholds to find and abstract. Each criteria is a design construct type and size threshold separated with = character. In each case, the size threshold causes constructs of that size or greater to be automatically abstracted from the formal model. Only construct 'mem' is supported for now. Example: -construct {mem=512}

cciOption.name: -skip_mem
cciOption.help: list of 'module.sigName' signals to be skipped from being inferred as memory.

cciOption.name: -skip_module
cciOption.help: list of 'module' names within which memory inferring has to be skipped.

cciOption.name: -force_mem
cciOption.help: list of 'module.sigName' signals to be forced to be inferred as memory.

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disable memory abstraction.

cciCmd.name: set_seq_abstractions
cciCmd.info: Sets the various abstraction settings for SEQ backend

cciOption.name: -construct
cciOption.help: list of design constructs and size thresholds to find and abstract. Each criteria is a design construct type and size threshold separated with = character. In each case, the size threshold causes constructs of that size or greater to be automatically abstracted from the formal model. Constructs are mem, mult, add, sub, div, mod, counter. Example: -construct {mult=4 mem=512}

cciOption.help: Clock period for the inferred clocks. Default is 100.

cciOption.name: -initial
cciOption.help: Initial clock value for the inferred clocks. Default is 1.

cciOption.name: -apply
cciOption.help: Create the inferred clocks in auto clock inferencing mode. Default is true.

cciOption.name: -infer_gated
cciOption.help: Enable/Disable gated inference in auto clock inferencing mode. Default is true.

cciCmd.name: fv_proof_arch
cciCmd.info: The main Proof Architect command, to allow compositional verification automation through tasks.

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Specify Proof Arch name.

cciOption.name: -type
cciOption.help: Create new Proof Arch of the given type. Possible values: assume_guarantee, copy.

cciOption.name: -append
cciOption.help: Append to an existing Proof Arch.

cciOption.name: -report
cciOption.help: Report all info related to this Proof Arch.

cciOption.name: -generate
cciOption.help: Generate tasks from the Proof Arch, without launching verification.

cciOption.name: -asserts
cciOption.help: List or collection of assertions

cciOption.name: -assumes
cciOption.help: List or collection of assumptions

cciOption.name: -ignore_status
cciOption.help: Ignore asserts of known status.

cciOption.name: -xml
cciOption.help: Produce a report in XML format.

cciOption.name: -list
cciOption.help: Returns all Proof Archs in the active task.

cciCmd.name: fv_setup_config
cciCmd.info: Configure design and formal related checks for VC-Static Formal

cciOption.name: -check
cciOption.help: Check name or list of check names. If no name is specified, it defaults to all checks

cciOption.name: -severity
cciOption.help: Determine severity to be used when running the check. By default, checks will have a severity of warning

cciOption.name: -autorun
cciOption.help: Automatically run this check at the specified checkpoint

cciOption.name: -disable
cciOption.help: Disable this check

cciOption.name: -enable
cciOption.help: Enable this check

cciOption.name: -list
cciOption.help: List the configuration

cciOption.name: -verbosity
cciOption.help: Verbosity level of messages for the specific check during checking. The default verbosity is summary

cciOption.name: -immediate_to_concurrent
cciOption.help: Change an immediate property to a concurrent property sampled by the reference or '-concurrent' specified clock. All properties of the specified usage are converted if '-name' is not specified. Applied globally. Values: assert, assume, cover

cciCmd.name: fvlearn_config
cciCmd.info: configure learn mode related setup for VC-Static Formal

cciOption.name: -server
cciOption.help: Current learning data will be stored to ml platform servers and then applied in subsequent runs.

cciOption.help: Current learning data will be stored locally and then applied in subsequent runs.

cciOption.help: Disable(0) or enable(1) RMA learning

cciOption.help: Current learning data will be stored locally.

cciOption.help: Local storage from where learned data will be used.

cciOption.help: Save learning data from the current run but do not apply any previous learning.

cciOption.help: Save extended learning

cciOption.name: -apply_only
cciOption.help: Apply learnt knowledge but do not save any new learning from the current run.

cciOption.help: Apply to all current tasks.

cciOption.help: Report RMA benefits on-fly

cciCmd.info: Specify user directed orchestration

cciOption.name: -property
cciOption.help: List or collections of properties

cciOption.name: -name
cciOption.help: Associated name tag

cciOption.name: -time
cciOption.help: Timeout for each property and engine pair. Units in seconds(S), minutes(M) or hours(H) (e.g. 37M)

cciOption.name: -mem
cciOption.help: Memory limit for each task. Units are GB or MB (12GB, 12000MB). Default is 8GB.

cciOption.name: -block
cciOption.help: Blocks next fvorc till tasks from current fvorc is complete

cciOption.name: -engine_list
cciOption.help: Shows the list of engine names supported in fvorc

cciOption.name: -order
cciOption.help: Order of execution of engines over properties

cciOption.name: -model
cciOption.help: Model used in the fvorc

cciOption.name: -engine_opts
cciOption.help: Engine options

cciOption.name: -all
cciOption.help: Run on all inconclusive goals in a single job

cciOption.name: -clear
cciOption.help: Clear all specified fvorcs in current user task

cciCmd.name: fvorc_config
cciCmd.info: Specifies certain configuration parameters for fvorc commands

cciOption.name: -include_effort_level
cciOption.help: Include effort level to the userorc. By default, it is set to false.

cciCmd.name: fvorder
cciCmd.info: Sets the formal search order attribute

cciOption.name: -clear
cciOption.help: Clear all orders.

cciOption.name: -print
cciOption.help: Print current order.

cciCmd.name: fvregister
cciCmd.info: Add a register with the specified signal name to the top design scope.

cciOption.name: -expr
cciOption.help: Combinational expression assigned to data input of the register.

cciOption.name: -scope
cciOption.help: Signals in expression are in the specified instance scope. XMR's in the expression will be resolved relative to the specified scope.

cciOption.name: -clock
cciOption.help: Clock signal to create a edge triggered register for the signal. Default is posedge triggered register.

cciOption.name: -negedge
cciOption.help: Clock the register on the negdege of the clock.

cciOption.name: -reset
cciOption.help: Reset signal for resetting the register synchronously. Use !<reset> to reset low.

cciOption.name: -initial
cciOption.help: Value for this register if -reset is specified, otherwise will be the initial state value of the register if it is X after reset

cciCmd.name: fvtask
cciCmd.info: command to set/create/delete a user verification task

cciOption.name: -create
cciOption.help: create a new task and make the active task

cciOption.name: -delete
cciOption.help: delete the specified task

cciOption.name: -limit_copy
cciOption.help: limits the copy to only the -asserts/-assumes/-covers and the specified -constants/-snips/-changeats/-abstractions. Requires -asserts, -assumes, or -covers to be specified.

cciOption.name: -copy
cciOption.help: copy objects of the specified task to the current/new task

cciOption.name: -appcopy
cciOption.help: copy objects from the specified app to the current task

cciOption.name: -attributes
cciOption.help: list of attribute value pairs

cciOption.name: -asserts
cciOption.help: List of names or collection of assertions to be copied from the specified task.

cciOption.name: -assumes
cciOption.help: List of names or collection of assumptions to be copied from the specified task.

cciOption.name: -covers
cciOption.help: List of names or collection of covers to be copied from the specified task.

cciOption.name: -constants
cciOption.help: List of existing constant signals or collection of constant signals to be copied to new task

cciOption.name: -snips
cciOption.help: List of existing snip signals or collection of snip signals to be copied to new task

cciOption.name: -changeats
cciOption.help: List of existing changeat signals or collection of changeat signals to be copied to new task

cciOption.name: -keep_status
cciOption.help: Keep the property goal status on task creation from the parent task

cciOption.name: -keep_task
cciOption.help: Keep the original task as the active task. If task_name is provided, the specified task will be created/modified, but will not be set as the active task.

Constructs are mult, div, add, sub, mod, pow, counter, mem, array, vector, array_comb, vector_comb, instance. Example: -construct {mult=16}
